Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardChelsea
Reviews.Content: The Buckingham hotel is located on W57th Street, a two minute walk from Central Park. The location is perfect for a truly New York experience. The common areas are quirky with lots of music memorabilia as it is located opposite Carnegie Hall. The rooms are simple, but very large and they have a kitchenette with a sink, hob and tea & coffee making facilities (teabags, coffee, milk & sugar etc are provided). My room was on the front of the hotel, there was a lot of street noise (as you'd expect for its location), and the heating wasn't great. Overall, a great base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Next time we'll choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPavel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights in May 2010. The location of the hotel is great - everything in Midtown & Central Park is in short walk. The hotel seems to be very old and definatly needs a renovation. Rooms are spacious but furniture is old and shabby. The bed is also old and not comfortable. The bathroom was at the same level. The view from the window was to the inner yard - means the view of the wall in front. . The breakfast was only available by room service. The advantage was the price we paid - was much less than other hotels nearby. Also we'd like to pay tribute to the staff - they tried to thier best in those circumstances. We changed room twice before find an acceptable one and received a complimentary drink. Next time we'll choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RAT IN OUR ROOM - NO JOKE (you've got to read this story)”
Reviews.Author: Aaron K
Reviews.Content: THERE WAS A RAT IN OUR ROOM! WE DEMANDED A REFUND. WHEN WE CHECKED IN THE GUY AT THE FRONT DESK CALLED THE CLEANER AND ASKED IF OUR ROOM WAS CLEAN OR DIRTY. When i check into a hotel i don't want to associate the word DIRTY and hotel room. I knew right then and there that the stay would be downhill from there. After checking in at 3:00 we went up the elevator to a very old smelly hallway. we opened the door to our room and were a little disappointed at the cleanliness of the room. The carpet hadn't been changed in decades, the bathroom looked old and the doors were from circa New Amsterdam. My girlfriend and I decided that we would take a nap, then go downstairs to the front desk to ask for an upgrade to a nicer and cleaner room. The guy at the front was quite understanding. He gave us a key to another room which was ALSO dirty. We both agreed we would just stay in the room we were in already. As we were getting ready to go for dinner, my girlfriend yells, "Aaron!! OMG!!." "WHAT?? WHAT??" "There's a rat in our room!!!!" I jumped up and looked under the bed and behold...a disgusting NYC rat was tucked up against the wall under the bed. We freaked out, ran downstairs and demanded a refund. The guy at the front desk had a couple maintenance people collect our belongings from the room and take them down to the lobby for us because there was no way in hell i was going back into the room. No questions asked, our money was refunded and the guy at the front desk was assisting us in finding other accommodations. Fortunately, we were able to find a MUCH nicer place..The Benjamin Hotel (where when we checked in and told the front desk our story, they upgraded us to a king bed suite). My name is Aaron and I would be HAPPY to convince anyone NOT to go to this hotel if they are planning a trip to NYC. Just send me an email at akatzis@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go To This Hotel if You Are Disabled”
Reviews.Author: Elaine S
Reviews.Content: Be very careful outside, they do not show outside photos. There is construction, and scaffolding with painted black poles. There is a bus stop outside, ok all of Manhattan has bus stops. to get to the bus, you have to pass the scaffolding. My husband is legally blind, while trying to get to the bus, he hit his nose on the steel scaffolding. He bled profusely, has headaches, and may have broken his nose. Thanks to caring New Yorkers who helped him with tissues and stayed with him till he could get up. He was on his way to work, and uses a cane, but because he is visually impaired, could not see the structure, due to its dark color. I tried contacting the hotel, but was unable to. I don't know who made the decision to paint them black, but clearly they are not considering people with visual disabililties. the structure supporting the scaffolding should be painted a bright color, white, yellow or red, not black. It is very dark underneath as it is, and the black poles make it worse to get around. This hotel is NOT DISABLED FRIENDLY.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Huge room”
Reviews.Author: NoelandJohn
Reviews.Content: Whislt the building was old it had great character we stayed in larger apartments not one of the studio room. There was a very large lounge room and bedroom, 4 wardrobes. The kitchen and bathroom were small but usable. They were closing down for a refurbishment soon after we stayed. It was easy to get around the city with the subway on the corner almost outside the front of the hotel. It was a little noisy with outside noise but you're in New York its a busy town. They played jazz music in all the passageways and lift to go with the history of all the legends that had lived or stayed in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in New York”
Reviews.Author: vestor42
Reviews.Content: Just 1 block from the Plaza but Oh what a differance. Room 3 times the size priced at about a third. It was a clean, large (Unheard of in New York) room at a fair price. It was a little dated but if you are looking for great location in "The Big Apple" for a price that leaves you money for sightseeing this is the place. No amenities other than location. 4 blocks to Central Park easy walking distance to theater district and restaurant row. It is definatley worth a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, but not without benefits”
Reviews.Author: delicatny_macho
Reviews.Content: The hotel has three main advantages. The first one is excellent location. I think it may be called - "5 minutes to anywhere". You just need to choose way of movement (by walk, by underground train, by taxi) and direction. Depending of that in 5 minutes you can get to Central Park, Apple Store, Carnegie Hall, MOMA, Saks Fifth Avenue, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Guggenheim Museum etc. The second benefit of the hotel is... there is no restaurant. But there are kitchens in the rooms which equipped with all you need for cooking. And there is a 24 h opened mini market right around the corner where you can buy all you need (including bread, milk, eggs, fruit, vegetables etc. and even cooked food). So you can save you money. And finally, the third benefit of the hotel is rooms' size. It is unbelievable, but it seems like you can play football or tennis in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Verastur
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Fair price, perfect location for theatre lovers, good service, spacious rooms - and cleaned! I have stayed at Buckingham several times and have booked so many of clients there. Never had a complain. I am travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Janice81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel over the Christmas period in December 2010. We stayed in a hostel for the first 4 nights of our stay in NYC and because we didn't like the hostel we decided to move to a hotel instead. So with very short notice, we managed to book a room with the Buckingham the day after Christmas Day and a reasonably price (by NYC's standards). First impressions of the hotel was good. Thought the reception was a little 'dark', the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was LARGE by NYC's standards - compared to our closet sized hostel room previous to staying at the Buckingham. The room and bathroom were clean. The only negative thing about the room was that I noticed it was quite cold as soon as we walked in. Seeing that we were right in winter and had just experienced a snowstorm (freezing outside!) I was quite adamant that the heating be good. We turned on the heater and it worked for the most part but I still felt like the room wasn't as warm as it should be. I called the front desk and they sent a portable heater to us which really helped warm the room. Once we got the portable heater, I was pretty happy and had no other complaints. The hotel's location is excellent! It is a one minute walk to the subway station. A 5 minute (or less) walk to Central Park and has lots of restaurants/cafes/pharmacies nearby. Very, very convenient. I would recommend any travelers/tourists, especially if it's your first time in NYC, to stay in this hotel purely for its location. It's central to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, would love to return”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Liz_83
Reviews.Content: We were actually meant to be staying in another hotel, however due to the snow blizzard we had to change properties (flight cancellations) and ended up staying for New Year (which was amazing!) Service: The staff were really friendly and advised on local area and transport Room: Brilliant, it was HUGE! with a walk in wardrobe, we loved it. Yes the kitchen is from 1970 but that didn't matter as who eats in when you're staying in NY!!! (p.s. i'm not rich, its just there's soooo many places to eat!) It would have been nice to get a room with a view of the roads instead of the air con system between the surrounding buildings. Also a general pointer about NY, I think I know why they call it the city that never sleeps; its because of the police and fire sirens that echos around NY 24/7. That's not saying its a rough place, we saw absolutely no sign of crime and every street has at least 1 police car! I want to live in NY and would feel happy living out of the Buckingham Hotel as its so homely.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and room for kids to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Annisejones
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Buckingham the week before Christmas. Our 3 girls are under 6 years of age. We had plenty of space for them to spread out and unwind. The small kitchen was a life saver and helped to keep our meal expenses down. I went to the corner grocer and purchased some yogurt and other breakfast items as well as some microwavable snacks. We spent full days walking and seeing the city. The last thing our girls wanted to do was sit still in a restaurant in the evening. There is also a wine store within walking distance. We kicked our feet up and had a glass once our girls were in bed. We walked and used the subway to get around. We were able to see WTC site, Statue of Liberty, Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller, FAO Schwartz, and the Natural History Museum in the 2.5 days were were in NYC. The staff was helpful and accommodating. The suite was clean considering the fixtures were dated. A deep cleaning would go a long way, but the room was clean on the surface. I appreciated the hardwood floor. I detest carpeting in hotel rooms as most just disguise filth and wreak havoc with my allergies. With solid surface flooring, you know if it is clean by looking. Overall, this hotel is a bargain. I have recommended this hotel to other families.

Reviews.Title: “like in a movie”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelgirl1
Reviews.Content: Like it a lot!!! great place! great stuff! great music and design... I felt myself like in a movie... I recommend this hotel. Great time

Reviews.Title: “Get the Suite!!”
Reviews.Author: mberm
Reviews.Content: So, I was only at the Buckingham for one night (saturday) over Valentines weekend but we could not have gotten a better deal. My boyfriend and I are from New Jersey, so this was not a vacation, just a place to stay for the night so we could enjoy a nice weekend together. We arrived early, and recieved an upgrade to the Bedroom Suite (on top of the awsome deal he got in the first place). This room was sooo worth it. It included a kitchen/eat in bar, living room and separate bedroom. This hotel room is exactly what I would look for in a New York City apartment (heres to hoping!) Great location, flexible staff that did not complain when we invited noisy friends over to pregame before we went out :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Suites!!!”
Reviews.Author: Musigal
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed in a suite on floor 5 and loved it. I did use earplugs at night, but that wasn't a big deal. But the room made up for it. It was huge! There was a kitchen, tons of closet space, fine bathroom, and nice living room. I couldn't believe I paid only $181 with a special promo for an event I was attending. A room like this is a major city should cost a lot more. It was a great location close to the subway and Carnegie Hall. Front desk staff were very nice. If you stay here, try the suites. Worth the money! We stayed here on Valentines.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb, hotel is average but clean”
Reviews.Author: moosey95
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Buckingham in december last year with a friend. We had a one bedroom suite as there was originally meant to be 3 of us travelling. Before going we were slightly worried after reading some of the bad reviews and I have to say now that I think people are a bit too picky. We basically wanted a hotel with a kicthen to cut our eating out costs down and there are very few of those around. Having already been "burnt" by trying to rent an apartment we found the Buckingham. The hotel is in such a good location. Central Park is just a few minutes walk, Time Square is about a 10 minute walk as is the Rockefeller Centre. It is on a busy main road so going back at night wasn't a problem although this did mean some traffic noise through the night but then again it's the price you pay for a good location. Just take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The room was large enough for 4 people to not be getting on top of each other. The furniture/decor is out dated but every thing was clean. The bathroom could do with an update but again it was clean and everything worked so no real complaints. The kitchen was adaquate for light meals and snacks which is pretty much all we wanted it for. Plenlty of closet space too. Enough for 2 girls clothes and christmas shopping anyway! The staff were very friendly and helpful. On hand to offer advice and to help out where needed. There is a very nice Italian restaurant next door, can't remember the name but the food was lovely and the price wasn't too bad either. For the price we payed I think the Buckingham did it's job and I would stay there again if I wanted to cut food costs. If you want a luxory hotel this isn't it but it is clean, spacious and in a great loccation. Can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, WORST accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter487
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the WORST stay in a hotel ever!! There was a MOUSE IN OUR ROOM!!! On the very first night there was a ruffling sound coming from the kitchen and it was a MOUSE!! We were on the 12th floor, so there's probably an insane infestation in that building. We were moved to another room, much larger, with a terrible smell of dirty drain coming from the bathroom. On the second day in that room, the toilet started leaking from underneath the bowl and we had to put toilet paper around it not to get our feet wet. We were in a corner in the middle of Manhattan and the windows were not noise proof. We could actually hear the cars honking as if it was inside our room. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THAT HOTEL IN ANY WAY. It was the price of a much better hotel for the accommodations of a NYC sidewalk. Do not stay there. Extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price outweigh age and outdatedness”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: Pros -- excellent location (a few blocks from Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall, and a very short walk to Rockefeller Center and the Christmas tree), very nice staff, my suite had a huge bedroom plus a seating area, bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, lots of clothes storage, very good price for December in NYC. Cons -- VERY old bathroom, cold bedroom, amenities were old (e.g., cathode ray tube TVs), paint was chipped and peeling, not enough light in the room areas. This hotel was an apartment building at one time, apparently, and some people still live there as residents. For a hotel in the middle of nowhere it would be poor, but for a NYC hotel hundreds of $$$ less than others in the midtown area at Christmastime, it was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: ComebackShane
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location The Bad: Dirty Looks like a crack house Rooms smell smokey I didnt understand why this got so many good reviews. Either the workers/investors are making the reviews, or people dont travel much and dont know any better. This hotel was filthy. They need to shut down for about 6 months and do a complete scrubbing on the place. I checked in, and took the elevator to the dark hallways. When I opened the room, the flooring was really old and had stained that soaked in the fibers for many many years. The bedding was clean. The bathroom was small and really dirty. I want not step bare foot in that place and the tub was a dirty stained white. There was a closet that was next to the bed, it had a stove and a little sink in it. The stove was electric and looked like it was more than 30 years old. I could not imagive ever making any kind of edible food. So lets get back to my story. The room was really smokey and smelled. Went back to the lobby and the lady let me switch room. The lady was very nice (I must add), and a pleasure to deal with. Then we went to another room, and it was bigger but still old and dirty looking. I looked under the bed and it needed a cleaning. Looked up the cushions of the couch and I guess it has been years since a vacuum has touched it. I wouldnt care to stay here if I was younger and on a budget. Back then I would just pass out on the bed, and wake up to a killer headache. Now I am older and have a large budget. I will NEVER consider this hotel as long as I live. This hotel was suggested by my travel agent. I am going to give her an ear full on Monday and tell her she better wake the F&^%$ck up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and big rooms - very practical and good value for those who don't want gold plate”
Reviews.Author: Marcdon331
Reviews.Content: Always tricky booking in New York: room size v location v cost v family friendly v noise etc - only road noise was an issue but you are in a great place near Carnegie Hall so no surprise and the chemist over the road sells ear plugs if you can't quickly get used to it. You are in a road with many nice shops (including Steinway pianos) and a block from Central park. Because this is an apartment hotel, there is no restaurant and some other facilities you get in a hotel, so it is probably classed 3 star but the people were 4+ star and the rooms massive by comparison with expensive battery hen cage hotels in Midtown. There is a patrons' floor with smart area, free broadband and small gym. Wood floor was scuffed but who cares - much better than a carpet (particularly with bed bug fears!). Bed was large and firm, sofa bed in very good condition, bedding and towels clean, and the kitchen industrial looking but useful even if for heating up leftovers from oversized restaurant portions! We stayed 5 nights and every day needed some sort of help or advice and it was always forthcoming and pleasant. Carlos the porter is a star, the cleaners very friendly, bathrooms not pretty but clean and had a good shower & bath, the maintenance guys quickly put some added locks on the windows without question because our 3 year old is quite intrepid. All the desk staff were at worst approachable & professional and a number of them were a joy despite it being very busy (marathon weekend). The breakfast service is continental and comes from the local deli so you can have a decent coffee, pastry, cereal, fruit delivered to the room for around £6.50. A little rough with the smooth is definitely worth it here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Soonerguy99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Buckingham Hotel from October 21st-25th. It is a in a great location, within 3 blocks of multiple subway stations; Central Park is literally right around the corner, 5th Avenue is a block away, Time Square is a few more blocks away. The staff was very friendly, always pleasant and more than helpful (helped us book dinner reservations more than once). We booked standard room that has lots of space (for a hotel in Manhattan for less than $250 a night) including a minifridge which is nice. The hotel is not a 5 star hotel, but for the cost you pay it is more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: EmilyJ911
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about five months before my trip. I was traveling with my elderly mother and wanted convenience and space. About two weeks before my trip, I read a lot of reviews that made me think that I might have made a huge mistake. I almost changed hotels to one of the major chains where I would have paid more for less space. I am glad I didn't. My mother and I had a 1 bedroom suite which was huge. Yes the bathroom was small but it was adequate and everything worked. It was NYC so it was a little noisy but no more than any other city. The location was fabulous -- my Mom was able to go to St. Patricks for mass twice and we were able to walk to Lincoln Ctr and broadway. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The rating of this place is not accurate!”
Reviews.Author: bradador
Reviews.Content: Ok first of all I travel to NYC every 3 weeks and have a very good idea of whats going on in the city as far as rating hotels go, and this is the first time i felt i needed to write a review about a hotel. There is no way that this place is even close to a 4 star rating. I always stay at 3.5 - 4.5 star places and i can't understand the rating of this place. The rooms are old (think like staying at your grandmothers old low rent apartment from the 1950s), parquet floors, closet doors falling off, rusted fixtures in the washroom, not working air condition. The room was a decnt size by NYC standards but unless i was given a room out of the twilight zone then i assume the rest of the hotel is the same judging by the way the hallways are. Believe me when i say that i would still stay at places like this since i am used to all things New York like small old rooms and noise but i felt i needed to write this since the rating was way off just so people would know what they were getting into. THIS PLACE IS NO MORE THAN A 2.5 star. I would rate it as a 2.5 but I give it the lowerst rating possible so that it hopefully pulls the average rating down for the place overall so people will understand what they are getting. I wonder if these are real reviews??

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Spacious and Clean! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: andrewt333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located within New York City and only a couple of blocks from Central Park. It's a wonderful area with plenty of cafes, bars, delis and restaurants nearby. Starbucks is located literally around the block. Therefore, location is the best part of this hotel. I was placed in one of the suites in this hotel. It is very spacious - even had to search for the bathroom the room was so large! The bed is comfortable and easy to sleep on. There is a small kitchen and a TV in the living room and bedroom. A truly comfortable stay! The receptionists are very friendly and always available. They are there at all hours and very courteous. The hotel is on a busy street (what hotel isn't in NYC?). So if you are a light sleeper and don't like traffic, it can get a bit loud. Although, I love the sounds of NYC and this place was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not as in Photos”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: We just checked into this hotel. The front desk staff is indifferent. The air conditioner in the livingroom does not work . The livingroom has a bed in it so you really can't call it a livingroom, since there is no sofa to sit on. The photos make the rooms look much nicer than they are in real life. The room is really dated. Bathroom is small, chairs are dirty, rug in bedroom is filthy. We were supposed to stay 4 nights...we are checking out tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: wheatfields011
Reviews.Content: If you decide to book a room in this hotel, make sure you bring ear plugs with you. Otherwise you are likely not to be able to sleep. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The first room that we were given was big enough and it looked clean. However, the sink was clogged and the furniture was very old, which made the room dark and gloomy. On our reservation sheet, we required a room that is quiet and on the upper floors. However, there was construction on the street just in front of the hotel and they gave us a room on the forth floor that just looks upon the construction. We were not able to sleep at all that night!!! We came to NYC for three nights and spent one of those nights struggling to sleep and having a really bad night. The next day, we wanted to switch rooms. the staff responded very unfriendly, said that it wasn't their fault, they didn't know that there will be construction (it as there when we checked in in the afternoon), and they could only change our room if there is another room available. They didn't apologize or made any soothing comments. We left the hotel for the day and packed out stuff because they told us that they would move our stuff to the new room if one became available. Upon return, when we asked for our keys, they said they couldn't move us to the new room because we didn't pack our stuff. We told them that we did! They found out that they confused us with another room,which also wanted to change rooms (we were not alone, apparently they had noise complains too). They, again, did not apologize for this confusion! The new room was smaller, and the TV was not working. It was fortunately not looking to the street but this time it was looking at the middle space where all the air conditioning were located. We managed to sleep but with the help of the ear plugs. The only positive experience we had was that they accepted to store our baggage for a couple of hours in the reception after we checked out (which is a standard thing for the hotels to do anyways). Its location was very convenient (right next to Central Park) but in the future I would choose a similar location but definitely a different hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: eneia01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Buckingham in a 1-bed suite after having stayed at the Affinia Shelburne last year and absolutely loving it. We learnt that the Buckingham was 'affiliated' to Affinia and thought it was a bargain. Well, for the location it was but I think that there must be some floors/rooms which have been 'done up' and some which really, really havent. Although the apartment was big (huge), it was in poor order. The kitchen cupboard doors were all cockeyed and didnt shut properly, the front was hanging off the heater and the heaters didnt work to begin with - we had the engineer out about 3 times within hours of getting there. When they did work, they made loud noises. The carpets were shabby - all freyed and rough at the edges where they met the wood floor and the handle to the bedroom was hanging off - we had the engineer screw it back on again. We did ask to be moved to a different apartment but were told that there were only rooms available, no other 1-bed suites which is what we wanted so we stayed put. On the plus side, great location - W57 between 6 and 7, right across the street from a Duane Reed and you must (must) try the little italian next door - doesnt look much but even my partner said the pizza was wonderful (and that's a rave review from him). Don't use taxis, use the underground - we even used it to go back to the airport with 2 huge rucksacks and handluggage - super convenient, quick and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Happyrocks
Reviews.Content: We got a deal email from the hotel for special rates over the July 4th weekend. So we decided to head to NYC for the July 4th weekend. We took our grand-daughter with us. We arrived at the hotel, checked in, then unloaded our bags from the car. the bellhop came out to help us and took our bags up to our room. The hotel does offer a deal with a close garage, but I was able to get a coupon on the internet for $25/day for a garage on 54th & 6th. short walk away. The suite we had was quite large. The kitchenette was a nice addition as we were able to bring breakfast items. There is a Walgreen's deli around the corner on 6th that is open 24hrs. Very convenient. We were very happy with the room and location. The staff was helpful as my wife slept in one day beyond the cleaning staff's day. They did call us and bring us fresh towels. The location was good, not far from anything we wanted to get to. It was also an interesting neighborhood to explore and walk around. We would definitely return. It would be nice if they offered free internet or charged a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “A good value at a great location”
Reviews.Author: LasMananitas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two daughters (in their 20s) stayed at the Buckingham for 5 nights and loved its central location - a comfortable walk north to the museums or south to the Theater District. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was VERY roomy and had a kitchenette. The rates are lower than other area hotels, but Internet access will cost an additional $12 per day if you use it in your room. It's free in the 2nd floor guest lounge though, if you take your laptop down there. The bed was comfy. The pull-out sofa was not, according to our daughters. Some street noise came up (on the 9th floor) but didn't keep us awake at night. The staff was polite and helpful. - Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sumac2010
Reviews.Content: As we walked in to our suite the lamps were lit and music was playing softly. We felt at home immediately and strayed that way for the next 8 nights. The 57th St/6th Ave location was perfect for our needs, walking distance to Lincoln Centre, Central Park, top shops and restaurants, plus the choice of two nearby subway stations for expeditions further afield. The tiny kitchen was all we needed for occasional snacks and breakfast, and having a separate bedroom and living area was great especially when friends came to call. We liked the Buckingham's style including lists of musical and theatre events in the lift (elevator). The only downside of the corner location was night traffic noise but it seemed a small price to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fgl19
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we had four in the room and they offered a suite. The suite had a queen bed and a sleep sofa. When we opened the sleep sofa, we found that the mattress was more like a flop house mattress. You could feel the coils of the mattress as you slept and would roll towards the middle the whole night. We called to get a mattress or something to place over the mattress and they could offer nothing. In fact, they recognized that the mattress was terrible but said that management would not do anything about it and many had complained. The lighting in room is bad and the place needs a complete renovation. Good location but poor quality for a hotel. We would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ajm1766
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about a year ago. I agree that the room was great - large, clean and with a kitchenette. I booked through Orbitz and got a great rate. In the morning, however, I was unable to take a shower because the tub (or toilet) from the floor above was leaking into the tub in my room! The front desk refused to do anything to assist me (such as offer another room to shower in or provide any kind of rate reduction). The hotel never answered my emails or phone calls. Orbitz was also unable to get the hotel to respond, but Orbitz did provide me with a rate reduction, even though they had nothing to do with the problem. I thought I had found a gem of a hotel in NYC, but I would not go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Mom&more
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel it was wonderful to enter the calm, quiet and efficient lobby of the Buckingham Hotel. The exterior entrance is understated (our taxi driver missed it) so be sure you know the address when you leave the airport – seeing the stained glass on Google street view helped us recognize the entrance and direct our taxi driver. We were in Room 14K which overlooks 57th street. The 2 rooms were spacious with plenty of closets. The kitchen had a small refrigerator, bar sink, 2 burner stove top and microwave. There were plates, eating utensils, and a few pots, pans and cooking utensils, including knifes to cut bread. The bathroom is small, but worked just fine. We enjoyed the street view, but it does increase the traffic noise at night. It didn’t bother us, but if you were a light sleeper you might want earplugs. The location is FANTASTIC, 2 short blocks to Central Park. City bus stops right outside entrance, and subway entrances within 2 blocks. The front desk arranged us good car service to the airport when we left. Weakness (which were easy to work around) include lack of free internet, we just went to their patron's lounge on the second floor where there is free WiFi; dining table that wasn't very stable, we were just careful; and a lack of towel bars and hooks in the bathroom (we are a family of 4 w/ 2 teenagers). If you are looking for an modern upscale hotel this might not be your best choice. If you are looking for a clean, safe, pleasant hotel this would be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment style rooms, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sara_and_Daniel
Reviews.Content: The Buckingham hotel is a classic New York hotel with a great location. The hotel itself has a rich history and the patina to match. Our "room" was a large one bedroom suite with a large separate living room. Mega space is not an exaggeration. The bathroom had been updated and was very clean. Location is great being at 57th & 7th, the f line is 30 steps to the corner and central park south is one block away. The staff couldn't have been better and are an example of what service should look like. In the immediate area you will find an amazing deli/store called the Well Good on 7th ave. There are also plenty of restaurants for eats such as pizza, steak, eggs, etc to satisfy many tastes. Very good value for money and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great price”
Reviews.Author: lismell
Reviews.Content: My sister, a friend and I stayed at this hotel last week for one week. The rooms are so big its amazing, So its great if you are 3 or 4 people. We got a really good deal on booking.com so the room worked out super cheap. It was quite hard to sleep at night on the 4th floor because of the streets below. We all used earplugs but still woke up a few times each night. The jetlag could also be the reason for that though. I would recommend this hotel if you get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: twanda13
Reviews.Content: Our room was surprisingly spacious. We loved being able to make breakfast in our room -- the little kitchenette was just the ticket. We also used the fridge for snacks (cheeses and salamis and salads from local bodegas). That's a real money saver! Clean and comfortable... and we can't say enough good things about the staff. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary, and I ordered 25 sterling roses to be there upon our arrival. The bouquet and vase were spectacular, and the hotel added a bottle of champagne -- an exceptionally nice touch. Also, when I ordered the flowers, the staff asked me if I wanted a room with a view -- or if it was more important to have a quiet room. I asked for quiet -- and our room was high above the noise below, and at the back of the hotel. No view, but wonderfully quiet. Just what we wanted! It;s located just across the street from Carnegie Hall, a block from a subway entrance... and a short walk to Times Square and all the Broadway shows and restaurants. What a time we had! And it was made all the better by staying in this wonderful hotel! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: RaeVikki92
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel enough. I travelled with my family of 4(2 adults, 2 children). We arrived to be told we had no reservation here and discovered the company we had booked it through had gone bust. The hotel staff helped us sort this out and even took time out to phone company for us. We eventually sorted it out and were surprised by the size of our room for it being New York and the price. Our room was more a suite it has a living room with a sofa bed, flatscreen tv, walk-in wardrobe, kitchen area with coffee maker and fridge. It led into another room attached which contained a king size bed, tv and walk-in wardrobe. There was a good sized en-suite bathroom. Our stay was perfect sofabed and king sized bed comfortable, staff went out their way to help us and the hotel was in a great location 5 minute walk from Times Square, Central Park and Empire State Building. I cannot think of anything negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory, great location”
Reviews.Author: Thatldo
Reviews.Content: We spent a great few days at the Buckingham a few weeks ago, and considering the location of this quaint but comfortable hotel we have to say we were pretty pleased with it. It's true that certain things could do with some attention: the aircon was a trifle noisy (and occasionally leaked), and the bathroom could do with a refurb. Also, our particular suite [11J] did have a rather strange `collapsible' concertina wardrobe door. But all in all everything else worked, it was great having so much room, with a fridge and sink and coffee-maker, and the bed and other furniture were plenty fine and comfortable. There were a host of other pluses, the lounge with wi-fi, lovely restful lift music, and very accommodating and friendly staff. The best feature though has to be the location (mid-Manhattan, coupla blocks from Central Park), but also it was just across the road from a general store and a mere two or three doors away from the nearest Green deli (great breakfasts): the only downside in this respect would be night-time noise from traffic on the crossroads below: but, hey, it's New York. Just don't forget your earplugs if you need silence for sleep time. I don't want to put anyone off though - this hotel is a terrific bargain and I'm sure we will be more than happy to go and stay there again. In fact we might well do.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value!”
Reviews.Author: derl1968
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great place to stay...Walking distance to Times Square, Radio City, Karnegie Hall...easy access to subways at both ends of the block. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Kitchenettes are small, but functional, and if you cook just one meal per day in your hotel you save a ton of money on food, so the kitchenette added real value to our stay. I would reccomend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “They will go out of their way to accomodate you!”
Reviews.Author: juneflower7
Reviews.Content: It was our 5 year anniversary, and we wanted to stay in a nice yet somewhat reasonable hotel in Manhattan, so we chose this place. We reserved the room online and I had asked for a high floor with a view in my reservation. We checked in and were given room 4C...we walked in and walked back out within a minute. There was a view of the next building and some pipes down below that made a loud sound, it was horrible! So we went right back downstairs and I told the woman, Candice, about our lack of view and the pipes. I said it was our 5 year anniversary and we wanted something on a high floor. She not only changed our room, she upgraded us to a suite!!!! When we went to our room, 9G, our jaws hit the floor. There was a beautiful corner suite with a living room, a kitchen, and the bedroom was a king! We had reserved a queen, so this was a great upgrade. And the view was spectacular, we could see the hustle and bustle down below us. Not only that, after we had come back from our stroll in central park (which is a block away from the hotel, and so is the subway), there was a bottle of champagne on our table! Candice had gotten it for us for our 5 year anniversary, complements of the hotel! We were so shocked! Because of the quick and responsive time, and the "not a problem" attitude, and the need to make our stay extra special, I rate this hotel 5 stars and would go back again in an instant! Another great thing to know is that you can call the hotel for any kind of reservations for dinner in the city, and they will reserve it for you. Candice asked our price range and got us an italian restaurant named Fragolino's next to Times Square for that evening for us. And Another staff member later gave us instructions on how to get o the Museum of Modern Art. The staff is very knowledgeable of the area, which is excellent for people like us who are not familiar with the city. And you can also order breakfast to be delivered to your room in the morning. We had gotten ours for free because it came with our room. All in all, if you want the Manhattan experience without busting your wallet, fantastic staff that will go out of your way for you, and breakfast in bed, the Buckingham Hotel is for YOU! I hope my review helped someone, it was hard to choose from all the hotels in Manhattan, but this place is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “hotel website was deceiving”
Reviews.Author: mjb3078
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel buckingham for 2 nights in a deluxe suite and the room was depicted in a much better fashion on pictures than reality. it was mediocre at best and the room smelled like old cigarette smoke., the location was awesome and it has a small but nice fitness center. the staff was average and helpful when we asked, but did not offer more than that. not a bad price for the location, but if you want to really feel like you are staying in a hotel (with all the nice amenities), then this is not it

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: the-rach
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a different hotel in NYC but kept an eye on the deals, and we found we could get 2 suites for 5 people (one studio, one 1 bedroom suite with a sofa bed in the lounge) for a cheaper price here than our original booking elsewhere. We were very happy with the deal we got. Firstly the location - pretty good. It's close to the park at the north end of Midtown. It's a bit of a walk to the Empire State Building and attractions in the south of Midtown, but it's great for the park and is by no means too far out of the way. The lobby was very pleasant, and the staff were great, no complaints there. The rooms were very spacious. Particularly the one bedroom suite, this was generously proportioned with wooden floors and big windows, and views down onto the street (we were on the 11th floor). It had a small kitchen and a dining table too. Also, the amount of storage was incredible! Several closets, a big chest of drawers too. The furniture was very nice and the room had the look of an apartment rather than a hotel room. There were a few negatives. There is no wifi in the bedrooms, but you can use it in the lobby and there is also a nice lounge on the 2nd floor where you can use it too. The bathroom was small and a bit shabby, with not enough space to hang towels. The air con unit was extremely loud. The first night we were there the room was hot and stuffy and we had to use the air conditioning, and it was far too loud for undisturbed sleep. It also looked like the air conditioner had leaked because the wooden floor underneath had obviously been damp at some point. But we only used it once so it wasn't a problem after that. The traffic noise is also noticeable, but hey, you're in NYC! The sofa bed was not comfortable at all. There was only one person sleeping on it and he complained that it was pretty bad and the springs were digging in his back. I certainly wouldn't advise you to book it with the intention of two adults sleeping on it, I think they would become very grumpy! Overall, we were pleased with what we got. It wasn't perfect, but I would recommend it to a friend. It was a really good price for NYC and a charming place to stay, if somewhat flawed.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Buckingham Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: UschiP
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to NYC for 7 days. Sandra was so helpul and gave us a one bedroom deluxe suite (11G), which was perfect for us, it gave my son his own space in the Living Room with a pull-out couch for sleeping. The apartment was very large, very clean, kitchen with all you need, really great !!!! Great location close to everything. We felt and lived as New Yorkers in the Buckingham Hotel. Staff was excellent and helpful. We definately stay at this hotel again !! Thank you again for this ejoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 Wonderful nights in 14E”
Reviews.Author: Larkie25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham Hotel for 5 nights in April and had a wonderful time. Hubby was very impressed with the amount of space that we got and said "Wow" as we entered. Initially I was planning to use Priceline to try and find a hotel around $125 per night. But some people suggested that we find a ‘cancelable back up’ so I started researching and found this hotel having a special of buy 4 nights and get the 5th free. Their deluxe suites were listed at $147 per night and with the 5th night free that brought our stay to $117 per night (with taxes it was total of $145 per night). I researched other hotels, and it just made me like this hotel even more. It’s not a new place, but it is very spacious. I’m typing this in our living room that is as big as our bedroom. We also have a full kitchen and it’s stocked with everything we need. The bathroom is sufficient, but it won’t win awards for cleanliness. I guess that’s where the age of the hotel shows up the most. And it has 2 closets and a walk in closet; we didn’t even know what to do with all of that space. They used to be apartments before it was remodeled into a hotel. We had a corner room on the 14th floor, 14E. We could see Central Park from our bedroom window and had a view down 6th Avenue. We could hear street noise but it wasn’t enough to wake me at night (I’m a light sleeper). We traveled with our sound machine and I used earplugs the first few nights but realized I really didn’t need them. Hubby slept like a log. And I don’t know what New Yorkers call the subway lines but we were right next to the BDFV line, one block from the NQRW, and two blocks from ACE and 123. So anytime we needed to go anywhere we just hopped on the subway and were there within 15 minutes (25 minutes to Battery Park in rush hour). If you are looking for a great location and comfortable room with a kitchen this is a great hotel, we’d definitely stay here again. I didn’t have any complaints, everything worked well and all the staff were very helpful. Would have loved WiFi in our room, but if we needed to get on the internet we just went down to the lounge on the 2nd floor, we also used the business center to print out tickets and our boarding passes. One afternoon I heard someone singing from the room next to ours and wondered if it was someone preparing for their concert at Carnige Hall. Then another day I heard a piano. Turns out a woman lived there before they’d changed it to a hotel and still lives there and she teaches music lessons. We loved the music theme to the hotel. So, now that you’ve decided to stay here, here are some tips: Check out the coupons downstairs at the front desk. We went to Top of the Rock and then came back and looked at their coupons and realized there were coupons right there for $2 off that attraction and many more places. We got a great map from the front desk that we used all week. Duane Reade is just across the street for Walgreens/CVS type things A little 24/7 grocery store called Green Market is just around the corner on 6th towards Central Park. They had fruit, drinks, snacks, a lunch/dinner bar, frozen stuff, etc. We wandered into this store at night before we went to bed to grab some breakfasty stuff for the next morning. Grab some water bottles and put them in your fridge to save money on getting them from a vendor. Angelo’s Coal Oven Pizza is about 3 doors down on the right if you are walking out of the hotel. We had a great dinner there one night for $37. It wasn’t crowded so they sat us upstairs on their balcony and we had a great view of 57th street. Hubby had great chicken parm and I had a delicious lagsagna. We also ate at Café Europa for $25 total and it would make an excellent breakfast place, thought pricey. We had quiche and soup and just brought most of the quiche back to eat for breakfast the next day. Starbucks is across 57th or down 6th. The metro is just a block or two away depending on which line you want to go on. Great location, great price! Thanks for a memorable stay for our first time in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A disaster of a hotel - don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Fethers53
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it had a lot of favourable reviews on this site. It was a big mistake - it is a terrible hotel. The lobby is nice and the staff were friendly but the rooms were awful. Ours both had dirty carpets with air conditioning units that were very noisy and in bits. The furniture was old and grotty with only one bedside light. The bathrooms were clean but very old and vastly in need of updating. The sofa beds that two of my children had to sleep in, had ot be set up by us and the mattresses were thin with springs sticking up - both teenagers got hardly a wink of sleep. Our bed was ok but there was a big hole in the sheet. It was very noisy and I hardly slept at all. The whole room had a grungy feeling - the sort of place you don't want to walk on the floor without shoes on. When I rang up (within 2 hours of checking in) to say that we were checking out 4 days early (i.e. the very next day) they didn't even ask why! We left first thing the next morning........

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: err218
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham for nine nights and were very pleased. The service was outstanding. Rooms were clean, small kitchen was a nice addition. We were not on the street so the room was quiet and we slept well. The location was the best, only a block from Fifth Avenue, and a few blocks from Central Park. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property look no further perfect for groups / families”
Reviews.Author: londonbabe73
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property , i stayed here with my partner and son ( 6) and got upgraded from a 1 bed apartment to a 2 room suite on the 16th floor . All i can say is wow !!!!!!! the rooms were MASSIVE my bedroom was approx 25 ft by 18 ft there were tv's in both bedrooms ( vital with children ) small kitchen with stove and large fridge freezer . kitchen had basic utensil's mugs glasses plates cutlery etc . The locations is steps from central park and approx 10 min walk from times sq and there is a subway station at the end of the road. so easy to jump on the subway . This is not a luxury property but certainly is not a motel 8 , the rooms are extremely clean but if space is factor head here yes there is no spa bath or dish washer in the kitchen but i would rather be here than at the hilton across the road where we spied on the residents in their tiny rooms with no facilities lol. there was no noise issues , except the normal nyc every day noises , the beds were comfortable and the water was hot . this is a classic retro building sure the air con clanked a bit the taps in the bathroom were a bit temperamental but it will def be my first choice when i'm back in nyc . the staff were helpful and every request was duly granted even a late check out when we had a late flight at no extra charge . The only con's i would say is no free internet ( but managed to snag the signal from the hotel across the road so all good lol but in 2010 to charge for wireless is a bit much i mean even motel 8 gives it free !! ) plus as it is a all suite hotel there is no restaurant etc but there are piles of restaurants everywhere nearby if your lucky enough to get a room book it quick ..................

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: AnneB13
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two 20-something daughters at The Buckingham for a long weekend and we all loved it. I requested a quiet room when I made my reservation via their website, and our room had NO street noise at all so we all slept great. Loved the roominess and the kitchen. Only problem was we had no heat one evening - slept fine under the comforter, but I had to call twice to get someone to come to our room and fix it in the morning. We were able to walk everywhere and loved the location. The price (with tax) per night was just over $200 which is terrific for the location and the amount of space. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: strastam
Reviews.Content: Helpfull and nice staff, Location near Central Park and Times Square was great. The room was big and ok, but the bathroom was narrow.

Reviews.Title: “BEST - Location, Value, Room”
Reviews.Author: gotothehub
Reviews.Content: Sandra and the team at The Buckingham do an amazing job. The location is best in the city. Right between two of the major subway lines, just off Central Park. Can't beat the value anywhere in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space and great location”
Reviews.Author: familytymeOntario
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel with two adults and two teenagers. The staff were excellent, they even gave us a book about New York as a gift when we checked out. The rooms are large, apartment size for New York. Yes, the hotel bathrooms and kitchen are in need of an upgrade but the hotel has character and charm that you can not find in a chain or modern hotel. The hotel uses a centralized heating system and we felt that the rooms were too hot on the cooler days, fortunately, the windows open and you can cool the rooms down quickly. There are lots of good restraurants, grocery, and wine stores nearby. Central Park is one block away, Times Square is only a short (4 blocks) away and the subway is right beside the hotel. The area is clean and safe, we never felt nervous about walking in the neighbourhood at night. The rooms are a little loud, from the traffic on 6th and 57th but did it not interfere with our enjoyment. The hotel offers free WiFi on the second floor but we had no problem connecting on the 16th floor. The hotel also offers a room service breakfast for only $10/pp but we never used it during our stay. We would definately stay at this hotel again. We felt and lived as New Yorkers for one week and had lots of rooms for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Earplugs Required”
Reviews.Author: GOCDO
Reviews.Content: It's a good location, it's more space than typical NY hotels but bring your earplugs. It's an old building with single-pane windows. You will know what it is like to literally sleep on 57th Street because the noise is off the charts, way beyond what you would normally get in the City. If you forget your earplugs, the Duane Read store across the street has some but be sure you get the "extreme" version. The pull-out sofa is far worse than any other pull-out sofa bed you've ever experienced, old and with a thin mattress–assume you will need a chiropractor if you have to use the sofa bed. If you're just looking for a place to sleep without any hotel amenities, and you have earplugs and you don't need the sofa bed, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deckerjw
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything. Plenty of space to stretch out too. But, location comes at a price. VERY NOISY., We had a corner room on the ninth floor and it sounded like we were on the street level. Sixth Avenue and Fifty Seventh Street has to be one of the most busy, bustling and noisy corners in the city. Single pane windows don't really do much to quiet the 24 hour noise in the city that doesn't sleep. Maybe try a room that doesn't have a street view?

Reviews.Title: “Nice location bad room”
Reviews.Author: JennyZh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 9 nights, bed is comfortable but after a while me and my boyfriend felt itch and have some bug bit marks on our legs, the 2nd last night the hotel had water issue, hot water was brown, my boyfriend has to take a cold shower, when I try to take shower there was no cold water, I been told there will be water in an hour, after 4hours the cold water is back the hot water is still brown. It’s not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value, great location, super staff”
Reviews.Author: susieq33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham for the second time this year - a girls' weekend with shopping, dining and theater. This is the second stay - first January. We chose to come back because the room was big enough to be an apartment, with a spacious living room, dining room, kitchen and great bedroom. This hotel is well located on 57th at 6th, so you can walk to museums, theaters, shopping and dining. We like the cozy lobby where someone always looks up and smiles as you walk in - makes you feel safer and less anonymous. The bellman Carlos is fun and the rest of the staff are always willing to answer questions. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Buckingham Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: artLongIsland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come to NYC for business every 6 weeks and always stay at the Buckingham Hotel. The rooms are big and comfortable, the staff is wonderful , and the location can't be beat. And the prices are great! It is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: nychappy55
Reviews.Content: Had a suite with kitchen, from other reviews was expecting pipes to keep us awake but there was little noise (We probably ae used to it coming from New England). I have to compliment the staff everyone was helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting”
Reviews.Author: GerardoGallo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and enough for staying on tourist purpose!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but defintely not a boutique hotel, as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel27_10
Reviews.Content: The Buckingham advertises itself as a boutique hotel, and says that it is affiliated with the Affinia chain, which we really like, but it was a huge disappointment. It was old, certainly not a boutique hotel, and it gave us the creeps. The rooms were not terribly spacious, although the closets were huge. The kitchenette was circa 1930. I wouldn't put my water bottle in the frig. The bathroom was old and tiny, and the caulking was in need of repair -- it just seemed dirty to us. It seemed like a residence -- maybe a studio -- from years gone by. The first night the smoke detector beeped all night and the heat was on high, and we couldn't control it, though we tried and my husband actually burned his hand! We reported both. The smoke detector was fixed, but the heat continued to blast, making the room terribly uncomfortable. There isn't much of a lobby, but there is a "patron's lounge," which is where we spent some time with our kids playing games. It has a TV and free Wi-Fi, but the business center is not free, even though the description in the blurb said that it was. They charge 50 cents per minute for computer use! Also, the fitness center, which is one of the reasons I chose this hotel because we both work out, was small and the machines were not the greatest. The staff was pleasant enough, but I just didn't get the feeling that they really cared. If all you want is location, then this place is for you. But if you are looking for something with more space, a larger and cleaner bathroom, and a view of something other than the workings of the building next door, chose some place else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Visitor061
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and safe. Front desk staff excellent, excellent maintenance staff. No problems during the stay. Hotel is clean and nice club room. It was easy to get to the subway. The kitchen in the suite is very convenient, there was free coffe in the room which was big by New York Standards. The check in and out was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: howard46
Reviews.Content: The Buckingham is located close to restaurants and theatres. Central Park is nearby as are the shops of Fith Avenue. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Well run --good location--exceptional”
Reviews.Author: poch1
Reviews.Content: The lobby was wonderfully quiet and classy---much nicer than the hyper-noisy atmosphere at most larger commercial establishments. The front desk and other staff were uniformly friendly, professional and helpful. My wife and I stayed in a very reasonably priced large one bedroom suite, complete with kitchen and two televisions. We entertained friends for breakfast (Starbucks and other coffee shops are nearby), and they couldn't believe the size and comfort level of the suite. All in all, a great place to relax and unwind, while visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Izabela_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near Central Park and all the main attractions of New York. I did not expect to have such a spacious suite which included good sized living areas and bedroom. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty of delis and restaurants in the area so that is not a problem. The only downside was the quality of the carpets in the corridors and smell of cigarette smoke in the corridors of floor 6.

Reviews.Title: “Too much street noise- too bad!”
Reviews.Author: zxg
Reviews.Content: The street noise from the 4th floor on 57th St. was terrible this time. My sister was on the 9th floor and it was terrible up there, too. Not good for sleeping. On the other hand, I have stayed here in an off-street room and loved it. This is a great hotel-- great location near the park and walkable to everything everything in midtown. Spacious, clean and nicely decorated apartments. Huge compared to what you can get elsewhere for the same price. Wonderful lobby on the second floor with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Content: The suite was large and we received an unexpected upgrade. The staff was wonderful, friendly and accomodating. They shattered the image that New Yorkers are not friendly (actually, everyone I dealt with on this trip was nice.) The windows may have been a little thin as I learned first hand why this is called the city that never sleeps however that would not affect my decision to stay here again. This was my first trip to NYC and for the size of the room and the location I feel the value was good. The Buckingham will be at the top of my list for my next visit to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Who Knew ?- "The Great NYC Secret"”
Reviews.Author: gpizzy
Reviews.Content: Well, now this hotel is a real pleasant surprise... We made a reservation with caution... seeking a great value and watching our budget for a two day NYC Holiday experience. We usually stay at the Omni Bershire or Michaelangelo, but the rates are still too steep in this recession. We parked at the hotel's official lot as instructed (self park) one block from the hotel. The hotel's entrance says it all.... artsey and unique with little signage. The lobby is small and adorable with the decor steeped in music. The staff was accomodating and helped us get in early, as we had matinee tickets to Wicked. Our room turned out to be an entire one bedroom NY City apartment with spectacular views up 6th Avenue and 57th Street. This "suite" was hugh with high ceilings with crown molding, closets larger than most NYC hotel rooms and a fully appointed kitchen. The suite was clean and we immediately felt at home. So now I know why the performers from Carnegie Hall loves this hotel. Oh yes... the Carnegie Deli delivers to your suite. The hotel has an entire bank of washers and dryers for guests and get this... a soda machine that cost 85 cents a can !!!! This property is so well located one wonders why the folks across the street living in multi million dollar condos just don't sell and move into the Buckingham. We explored this area of the city in all directions and found the former Coliseum on Columbus Circle a treasure. Check out the huge sculpture of "Somebody" in the lobby, you can't stop laughing. It's fun just watching the reaction of shoppers when they first gaze upon this formidable male sculpture. Back to the hotel... The Director of Front Office, Sandra Arias is GEM... you simply cannot leave the hotel unsatisfied if you let her know you need help. So if it's living like a NYC millionaire on a recession budget and getting it all... you can't miss staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location If You Don't Mind Not Sleeping From The Noise”
Reviews.Author: Ringfinger
Reviews.Content: I love NYC. I have been there many times. I will keep it simple. For close to $300/night, you would expect to be able to sleep. But oh no!! I slept on the pullout couch with my son, my wife and daughter in the bedroom. Turns out, they put us on the 4th floor, facing 6th ave. Take my word for it, it is a busy avenue. The windows do not latch quite right, regardless, they need double pane windows. It was beyond loud 24/7. The room is a sauna, the heat will not shut off but opening the windows only increases the noise level. The bed I was in was spring and basically no cushion/padding. Marvin, the lovely gentleman who helped me with my bags was a bright spot. The location is great as long as you are on the 17th floor facing nothing that resembles activity. So sad it turned out this way as it was the first time I took my family all together to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room size, needs some attention, but good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: josephine2
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful but some more than others. The room was a great size - we had a larger suite with a separate bedroom. The kitchen was fully equipped and a good size, with an adjoining living room with settees, lounge chairs and a desk but no dining table or chairs which was surprising. There was lots of cupboard space and a walk-in wardrobe which was a great advantage. There was a bath, but the bathroom definitely needed renovation and one day we had a terrible experience with dirty brown water gushing out of the taps. The location was excellent, it was very easy to get around - we could walk to many places we wanted to go and there was a subway just around the corner. We didn't use the gym which seemed quite well equipped or the internet in the lounge. We were happy to have the kitchen and we generally prepared our own breakfasts but there were numerous supermarkets and shops nearby where we could buy fresh bread, bagels, fruit and anything else we wanted. We even found two good coffee shops nearby - one in the Meridian Hotel and the other, a tiny Italian style hole in the wall, in 6th street just around the corner. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A well Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: simonedex
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews here. I didnt want to stay in a chain hotel. The service is outstanding. That staff is friendly, and well informed. The rooms are large, clean and quiet. The location is perfect just two stops on the F train downtown, and you are on 42nd street. complete with all that time square, broadway hustle bustle. There are several dining spots, delies. starbucks, and a grocery store is not even a block away from the hotel. There is a great little new york style diner across the street on 6th and 57th, you can get a great breakfast for 4 bucks. It is close to central park, Tiffany's, Trump tower, ffith avenue shopping is just blocks away from this lovely hotel. I travelled there alone, I felt safe, and had no security issues whatsoever. Its is priced decent for a New York hotel. Keep in mind it is New york., so it may seem pricey to folks who have not booked a hotel in the past. I will be traveling back to New York in January. I plan to stay at the Buckingham.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: DERClovis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a friendly-accommodating staffed. They were eager to take care of our needs. I contacted them by e-mail before we left home and they were prepared when we arrived. The Buckingham is located in walking distance to Time Square, Carnegie Hall and Central Park. . It was a very pleasant stay. My wife left a jacket behind and they mailed it to us within a couple of days. Thank You Staff of the Buckingham. We will stay with you again when we come back to New York. Thank, Dennis Ricken

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updates”
Reviews.Author: DrMissy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the only hotels with a kitchen that can be found in Manhattan. It was nice to have a kitchen, especially with kids. The space was large for Manhattan as well. The location is great...close to central park; subway entrance close by. The building is old and the old windows do not keep out the street noise. The space and furnishings desperately need updating. The bed was as hard as the floor. The pull-out in the couch was nothing but springs. After a long day of running around the one thing you want is a comfortable bed in which to rest....not here! The other furnishings were old and dirty. This place could be nice if they spent some money on updates. Next time we head to the big apple we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Our choice for NYC - space, location, no gimmicks”
Reviews.Author: etaoin
Reviews.Content: Historically the Buckingham is where people performing at Carnegie Hall (across the street) stay. If you have play or work to do in New York and would like your hotel to be 100% but not get in your way, you should stay here. You are more likely in the elevator to overhear discussions in other languages about negotiations with composers and musicians than to see any tourists. No fancy lobby or shops, there are hundreds of restaurants and stores within a few blocks. Some of the rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures, some are more like an ordinary nice New York apartment. But they are big, two parties can share a suite easily (with kitchen) for a little more than what other midtown hotels charge for a double room. The windows in the rooms are not soundproof -- but this is Manhattan and personally I would prefer . Mostly hardwood floors, excellent beds and linens. No free wi-fi except in the lounge on the second floor which is a convenient place to meet. The staff are unobtrusive, professional and expert (for the very few requests we've needed to make over the years of staying here one every year or two).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachreaderUK
Reviews.Content: I had been to New York once before, but this time I was taking my parents for a special anniversary present. They hadn't been to NY before, and we wanted to have a suite that we could share. We got a really nice room. My parents had their own bedroom and I got the pull-out bed in the living area. The cost was amazingly good value for NY, and my parents loved being near to Central Park (about 2 mins walk away). 2 good subway routes were nearby which was very handy when we wanted to go down to the Empire State and Battery Park. The staff at this hotel are v friendly and v responsive. I contacted them in advance to check all was ok with my booking. I was a little hesitant before I got to the hotel as I had read a few less complimentary reviews on here, but I have to say the hotel was really good. My parents loved it. The suite was pretty big, clean and met all of our expectations. If you're looking for a hotel nr to Central Park and a pleasant 20min walk or so to Times Sq, and you want to get really good value for money, then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms great for large family trips”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaGatorMom
Reviews.Content: My family met up in New York for a vacation. The place is a bunch of Condos turned hotel rooms, each one is different. This is an old building so it is hit or miss but for the 3 rooms I saw, it is really a decent place to stay with a group. You also have a kitchen so you can make breakfast or just get pizza and eat in for dinner. The windows are old so expect to hear the sounds of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a bit basic & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cazanny
Reviews.Content: On arrival, my friend and I were given the key to a room on the 5th floor where the decor looked very tired and paintwork was marked and grubby; it felt very depressing. Having read earlier reviews, we went back to reception and asked whether we could have a refurbished room and were given the key to a room on the 6th floor, which was a lot better, though still nothing write home about. We were still unpacking when a couple let themselves into our room, with a key which they had been given mistakenly, as the message hadn't been passed on that we had moved rooms - good job we hadn't gone out! My friend slept in the bed and I was in the sofa bed was was pretty uncomfortable, but we managed. It was a brilliant location, very central, but the hotel itself was ordinary,& the staff seemed a bit bored. If I was going to NY again, I would take my chances on another hotel rather than going back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Gina's helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: travlelerjudy
Reviews.Content: We have been at this hotel many times in the past few years. The staff is friendly and helpful. This past visit Gina was extremely good to us in selecting a wonderful room. sincerly yours, Judith Adelman Birmingham, Mi.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: boorne
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC for my sister in laws 50th as a party of 8 and could not have enjoyed the Buckingham more. The front desk staff were all friendly, efficent, knowledgable and went the extra mile even when not requested. The rooms were on the large size and each had their own design and feel. Each had mircowave, coffee, iron, small kitchen (some with stove top) and refrig. It was central to everything and had several subway locations within a block or two. A block off 5th ave you would expect to pay much more but it was value and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly staff and overall good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowbornandbread
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that I have stayed at the Buckingham Hotel in New York. Great location ! Warm, and friendly staff. Great service and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to excelent staff!”
Reviews.Author: brazilian2005
Reviews.Content: I´d like to thanks everyone on this hotel for the fantastic stay we had! The location is probably the best for tourist, we had everything we need in steps from the Hotel. The room was very big, the soft jazz music in the elevator made me feel really in NYC! Ask Sandra and the excellent staff ( special thanks to Claudette) to help you, and they will be there!

Reviews.Title: “this place is really nice”
Reviews.Author: Grandmanewy0rk
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay while my house was being painted - the fumes from the paint aggravate my asthma - so my daughter suggested I say here, since it was close to her apartment and her place was too small. From the moment that I walked into this hotel, I was really pleased. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean and had lots of space. I called downstairs to ask about places to eat and they were very helpful. I was extremely happy with my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Great Location! Fun Time!”
Reviews.Author: camnjmom
Reviews.Content: We just got back to California after a great trip to New York! We were very apprehensive about picking a hotel off the internet - especially after reading some of the less complimentary reviews - but, after contacting the hotel by e-mail, we decided to give it a try. The Buckingham Hotel was perfect for us. We were greeted at the door by a friendly, helpful staff member (Marvin) who helped us unload all of our luggage and took it up to our room which was a wonderful start to our New York adventure. Then, we were welcomed by a friendly front desk staff including Sandra Arrias who I had been corresponding with by e-mail. Sandra and other staff members gave us restaurant suggestions, parking information, and directions several times throughout our visit which really helped us. We were 5 women traveling together - most of us visiting New York for the first time - and we wanted a comfortable, safe, convenient and economical place to stay and THIS WAS IT!! We had two rooms (16H & 14C) and they were both perfect - lots of room to spread out and relax when we had the chance. We didn't do much cooking but having the refrigerator and microwave available for quick breakfasts was wonderful. The rooms are certainly not modern or "glitzy" but they are comfortable and clean which is what we wanted and the beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in at a hotel. In addition, the location of the hotel can not be beat. It is steps to the subway, a block from Central Park, a couple of blocks from the tour bus stops and a short walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. We were out several nights past midnight and always felt safe and comfortable coming to and from the hotel. If and when we ever have the opportunity to return to New York, we will definitely be staying at The Buckingham.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: culturebug
Reviews.Content: This hotel offer good access to all the major attraction such as MOMA, LIncolin Center, Upper Westside, and upscuale shopping and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCJane
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Buckingham. We got a really good rate from Travelzoo and the location couldn't have been better. The room had a lot of character, was very clean and spacious, and met our needs really well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc098
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a very nice hotel. The room was a nice size. It was quiet. The staff was extremely kind, friendly and helpful. The only thing I didn't like was that the cabinet in the bathroom was too close to the toilet.
