Reviews.Title: “Great Service, prime location why would you stay anywere else!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckyprince
Reviews.Content: the hospitality and treatment from the staff was remarkable. i would recommend anyone that visits NYC to stay at this hotel and the location is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: va23192
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay! Nice staff and awesome location! We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alw5755
Reviews.Content: A great place to base your NYC experience from. A block from Central Park, the hotel was convenient and a great deal. Have stayed here many times and would continue to enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: bamma1926
Reviews.Content: So for the price we expected more. Parking through their garage was 150.00 for 3 nights! Was outrageous, and the room was 167 a night. The bathroom was awful, the shower barely drained. It was nice that the room had a kitchen, so we bought our own cereal and could store food and drinks. The bed was awful. very bouncy. Kinda farther away from most of everything but close to subway and 2 blocks from central park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people and public areas - room was a dump”
Reviews.Author: Frank02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham for one night on a recent family trip to NYC. We picked the hotel as we've stayed a number of times at other Affinia hotels and have had positive experiences. The hotel is well located and the people and public areas were nice. Our room (4C) was however, a dump. It was dirty, not painted or updated in many years, and the furniture looked like it was picked up off the street (that was being thrown away.) The bathroom was dingy with handles broken off of the shower door. The pull-out sofa was partially broken and barely usable. There were also no blankets in the room for the pull-out sofa. Oh, and the plumbing noises from the bathroom next door seemed to be located right behind the headboard for the bed and were surprisingly loud. I've made these comments directly to the hotel in the questionairre that they sent to me after we checked out and have received no response to date.

Reviews.Title: “Warmed to the hotel after initial disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sandlj
Reviews.Content: Was recommended by a friend so I expected a modern classy place. The foyer was dated but the staff were friendly and helpful. The stale cigarette smell in the hallway was almost enough to make me leave but we stayed. My 90 year old father enjoyed the cosy comfortable bed and my 11 year old son and I suffered with the sofabed that was really only covered coils! However, the location was fantastic and the kitchen saved us a lot of money and had everything we needed. The staff were fantastic and that really made the stay pleasant. We got used to the smells and we even managed to sleep on the coils. Great for those who want a bit more room, a separate bedroom and the ability to prepare own meals. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: bluesly
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I found this hotel! Affordable, large rooms and exceptional service. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance near the Park”
Reviews.Author: nycdoc333
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Buckingham. Tucked away on the corner of 57th and 6th ave. the warm colors were inviting upon entering the foyer. During my 2 day, staff was always professional, prompt and most importantly, flexible when I needed extra things for my room. Business conference was spacious clean with 24 hour access. The 1 bedroom suite with adjacent living space and kitchen was very roomy as well. Just 1 block from central park, it was nice to get a small piece of nature among all that concrete and steel of the city. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for me”
Reviews.Author: NoodlesSydney
Reviews.Content: The layout and level of amenity of my studio suite was exactly as I hoped it would be. I appreciated the space and the lack of fussy detail. There was no unnecessary extra: the functional kitchen was a boon, the attention to general comfort through furnishing, cleanliness and maintenance were clearly the hotel's main focus and strength. The tea and coffee supplies were kept topped up and toiletries were good quality and not drowned in fragrance. There was an unpretentious but strong arts focus in the lobby and elevator which helped define the mood and the staff were calm and polite without being obsequious. I felt good choices had been made in all of this and I felt pleased to have chosen the Buckingham.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but dated and not well maintained. Kitchen a joke.”
Reviews.Author: caseylight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this week for two nights and booked our stay through hotwire. I was attracted to the hotel because of the location and the square footage of the room, along with the fact that it came with a kitchen. Traveling with a teenage son, we were looking to save money by eating a few meals in, choosing instead to spend our dollars on nightlife. The kitchen was so small, we couldn't fully open the fridge door - not kidding. It hit the wall! The kitchen was not fully equipped. I had to call the front desk to ask them to bring silverware up and a sharp knife. There also was no sponge for washing dishes and no hot pad for holding a hot pan. Clearly this is a kitchen best suited for someone who just wants to toast a bagel and have coffee in the morning and nothing else. The sofa had a cigarette burn on the back cushion and the bathtub's finish was coming off. There were so few outlets in the room, we had trouble finding an available one to plug in our cell phone. Wifi was only available on the 2nd floor. A bright spot was the fitness center, which was much better than most hotels and came with a sauna. It, along with the 2nd floor lounge had been recently remodeled. The rest of the hotel was very dated and not well maintained. The sleep sofa had the thinnest mattress I'd ever seen. Our bed (queen sized) was comfy. Ventilation wasn't the best either. The lobby was always very comfortably cool, but we could never get the room to be comfortable. It was always too warm no matter how we set the a/c. Bottom line. Location was great - right across from Carnegie Hall and the Director's Guild Theatre, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was like a home away from home, thank you Buckingham”
Reviews.Author: bruceblackwood
Reviews.Content: 1st time at this hotel and we booked by telephone from Australia.. We had a suite on the 15th floor ( 15E ) and it was like a home away from home. The suite was to our amazement was huge, kitchen/lounge with full cooking facilities and 2 convenience stores closeby.( 1 just around the corner and liquor store as well ) The kitchen also has a full size fridge. The bed was very comfortable and the size of the rooms excellent.The bedroom was completely separate from the rest of the rooms. The hotel is getting on a bit in age so the furniture reflects this a bit, but if you are tired of having a squeezy hotel room then this is for you. The Hotel was a 5 minute walk to Central Park and a 20 minute walk to Times Square. The Subway to all lines are within a 5 minute walk. The Hotel does not have a restaurant but you have a huge selection closeby. The cab fare from JFK to the hotel was $45 USD. The cost of the hotel was very reasonable (for a suite) $187 plus tax. Definately recommend this hotel based on value for money.

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Beth088
Reviews.Content: Pros--- Hotel is in a great location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was spacious and pretty clean. Cons---- bed was uncomfortable, (small cheap mattress---could feel the springs) some of the lights didn't work, single pane windows --so we heard every car that passed by. Hallway smelled like smoke. Had to take a cold shower one day. The room they first put us in had a funky, mildew type smell---and we could see where the ceilings had leaked and they had attempted to paint over it to cover it up. We requested to be moved to another room and they accommodated us---the new room was better---but it did not have the kitchen in it---but that was fine because we didn't really need it. We thought about checking out and getting our money back---but we figured it would just be a hassle so we stuck it out and stayed. If we ever come back to New York. we will not stay at the Buckingham. Do not be mislead by internet photos---We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and we were not impressed. This is an old apartment building with some new carpet and paint----if your not real picky then for the money it is an ok deal----hindsight is 20-20. I would have rather paid a little more and stayed somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Buckingham Hotel New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: luvpugVirginia
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The room was extremely comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff was very professional. Everyone made you feel like they were glad to have you stay. The location was great and everything you could possibly need for a wonderful stay was within walking distance. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: joeschmoe4
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Room was infested with bed bugs. Suffered bites on ankles and arms. Left early next morning and booked a room at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, a bargain”
Reviews.Author: NH1212
Reviews.Content: I see some negative review on this space and I do not know what these reviewers are taling about. I stayed at the Buckingham May, 26, 27 & 28th. The experience was wonderful, particularly in terms of the price, about $160 per night. In Manhattan terms, for a hotel of this quality, that is a steal. I'm an author who had three publishing appointments right on 57th Street. So for starters, the location was escellent. The location is also perfect for midtown, Lincoln Center, Central Park or the theater. I'm also an ex-NYer who has moved away, so I enjoy being able to walk everfywhere I need to go. The hotel's booking agent put me exactly where I wanted to be (high floor, the 14th, overlooking 57th) the room was very clean, well lit and comfortable. The kitchen was fully equipped, all utensils clean. Maid service was excellent, quick and efficient. Check in, check out were each completed within 5 minutes. Everyone I encountered on your front desk, day and night, was right on the ball, pleasant and able to answer any questions. When the airport van stopped on 6th instead of infront of the building when I was departing for JFK, the doorman was quick to help me with a large bag. The only tiny glitch, a coffee maker that didn't work (not the hotel's fault). I mentioned it and a replacement with there in minutes. This is an older building, but that, to most NYers, is an asset. The room I had was like an old fashioned studio apartment, in NY terms. There is bus service immediately nearby, subway also. The area is safe 24/7. Oh, yes. There's a 24/7 Duane Reade drug store across the street and an all night grocery around the corner on 6th Avenue. Most of the criticisms of the hotel on these space seem to be from people who didn't know what to expect from a NY hotel or would have been happier in a bigger more touristy (and MUCH more expensive) location. So be it. Needless to say, the negativces recounted by others here were not part of my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Bathroom, but good location and size...”
Reviews.Author: WrldTraveler30
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself is small and lacking of basic services (can't buy a bottle of water from the hotel). The rooms are supposed to be all suites though. We got a small room, no couch in sight so I wouldn't consider it a suite, but they did have a small kitchen, wich was a plus, since we were traveling with children. The size was on the large side of all hotels I've stayed in Manhattan, but the bathroom, oh my, the bathroom... What a horrid little place. Very outdated, very creepy, broken tiles, tiny toilet, really, it was so awful I feel like words aren't enough to describe it. On the up side, it is a good location and I got a great deal at hotwire and paid only $129 for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't sleep a wink”
Reviews.Author: flowerchat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel five years ago and had a nice room, clean with acceptable bed and relatively well isolated windows facing the streets. But this time!!Luckily we checked out and changed hotels right after the first night. The room was very big, I mean the living room. The bedroom, where you end up spending most of your time was tiny, stinky and the bed was literally falling apart. Very bad mattress and sheets that felt like polyester plastic on your skin. Cleanliness was questionable. Everything was topped by the poor isolation in the windows that were facing to the back of the building where the aircon machine was making airplane engine- like noise and I didn't sleep a wink without having nightmares about airplanes. I would rather stay in a well appointed small room with a proper bed and bathroom than in this noisy suite that is falling apart. For the same amount of money it is possible in mid-town so don't waste money on this 'over sized' nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “OK... if you know what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: NK
Reviews.Content: The Buckingham is a former apartment building consequently it is not your typical hotel and if you go in knowing that, you may well enjoy it. The pros: great location at 57th and 6th, close to Carnegie Hall (the hotel has a music theme to its decor), Central Park, subways, MOMA and lots of restaurants. Also if you get a deluxe suite you are getting your own apartment with large living room and a kitchen (a small typical NYC kitchen.) That's great if you're there for multiple days. The cons: really, really noisy location because 57th is a cross-town thoroughfare plus has bus service on it and has a lots of construction going on. (They were jack hammering at midnight one night.) Very limited technical infrastructure for computers (don't bother getting the modem unit; it's useless) and very few electrical outlets in the room. No tech knowledge or support from staff. Pokey bathroom with disintegrating tile, and a bad mattress on the bed. TV reception was all screwed up ( we got a weird selection of speciality stations but no mainstream stations.) Oddly, despite all these problems, we had a good time and enjoyed the location. The rooms vary significantly. We had friends staying there too so saw 3 rooms altogether and they were all very different in layout, comfort and condition. My advice, book only a deluxe room. Make them move you if you don't like the room. Leave your computer at home. And bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: GrantL
Reviews.Content: Location is good. It's like a very small apartment. However, otherwise, the rooms are not worth it: very uncomfortable bed, very small bathroom, very cheap furnishings, strong odor of cleaning fluid in the room, no amenities in the hotel, no room internet. For the same price, I would have been far, far better off at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain of the Century”
Reviews.Author: nextdaycorn
Reviews.Content: Bargain of the century in Midtown Manhattan!! On the corner of 6th ave and W 57th st, 2 blocks from Central park, Subway outside the door, <1 mile from Times Square. We paid $204 per night (internet special) for 3 nights 12/16-12/19 2008 for a basic room. When we checked in we were given a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite (11G) which was very large—Huge by NY standards which had a separate bedroom, kitchen, and Living room/Dining room. The furniture was reasonable though the bed could use an update, so could the bathroom. Good water pressure, excellent front desk staff, but most importantly—in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space and Value”
Reviews.Author: basingstokecambridge
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at a different hotel for the weekend, but the day before arriving in New York I saw a rate of $159 for an executive one bedroom king suite at The Buckingham on Quikbook. Although the hotel has fairly mixed reviews on TA, I have always been interested in trying this property because of the space and the musical history of the hotel. I booked this amazing rate and I wasn`t disappointed. We walked into a huge apartment, immaculately kept and nicely decorated. The full kitchen had new appliances including a full refrigerator, cooktop stove and oven, stainless steel dishwasher, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. Also cookware, flatware and dishes. There was a full dining table and chairs, queen sized sofa bed, a large bedroom and plenty of closet space. Also 2 televisions, 2 dvd players, vhs and stereo system with wireless speakers. The spacious bathroom wasn`t contemporary, but charming with crown molding, new fixtures, abundant towels, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. We loved having our own New York pied-a -terre. The front desk staff was talkative and extroverted at check in and check out. This was a great experience and we`ll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Glitteryvix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Buckingham for 3 nights 29th Dec ’08 – 1st Jan ’09. We got to the hotel early, before check in, and so the reception took our bags off us and we went for a wander. I couldn’t believe just how close to Central Park this hotel was, literally a minute walk! It is in a great location with some great amenities nearby – there is shop/pharmacy opposite, several restaurants and a great little deli/café nearby (if you come out the hotel and turn left, go over the road, turn left again and it right there) that was so cheap and delicious, we had breakfast there aswell a pizza one night..and not forgetting cheesecake! Yum! We went back to the hotel to check in and our room wasn’t ready still, we weren’t concerned by this and were just going to head back to central park, but the lady on reception then offered to upgrade us for free! We never asked, or made a fuss so we were very surprised, and thrilled! Our room was on the 15th floor, it was incredible. It was an apartment with a lounge area, dining room, kitchen, bedroom and bathroom! We really enjoyed our stay at the Buckingham, we had not a single problem, it was incredibly clean and comfortable, with a great heating and central heating system and friendly help full staff, and to top it all off…. in a perfect location. The only thing to point out is that not only is New York the city that never sleeps…it’s also the city that never lets you sleep, as there is quite a lot of traffic noise at this hotel, but it wouldn’t put me off staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Failed to live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: clarbner
Reviews.Content: Web site is very misleading - studio suite was not as suggested by site - in particular, kitchen fitted into cupboard (not a huge problem, but not as web site suggested) and there was no table to work at - big problem; not suitable for business trips. The only table was a side-table with stereo on it which was too high to work on and in any event was uneven so moved about when I attempted to work at it. Had to sit on bed with computer to work - not satisfactory. Web site also advertised free internet access to each room (I see it has now changed to business centre) which was very important to me (and I had specifically requested it in email booking). No such luck. Offered huge clunky modem for insane sum per night - tried it but didn't work so gave up. Not much help from front desk on advising about obtaining internet access near the hotel - ended up finding some for myself at a USP down the block. "Business Centre" - if you can call it that - had one computer which could be accessed only with assistance during business hours (useless if in business meetings/conference all day and need to use it in evening) - theoretically had wireless available which some people seemed to access but I was unable to access it (not sure why - managed to get 'free city access' from NBC if I held my computer up against the window in my room at an odd angle, but that was too unreliable to use most of the time!). Room only had a couple of very old fashioned power outlets and not all of them worked - not helpful if have computer/phone and other devices to power up - I had to unplug stereo etc just to plug in computer. Not fussed about the size, but some honest advertising would be nice. Decided to take bath to relax one night only to discover plug did not fit properly so water just poured out of it as fast as it went in. Pipes very noisy so needed to avoid using bathroom at night. Incredibly noisy - I know it's to be expected on level 5 opposite main street but window fittings did nothing to help. Heating/cooling system also very noisy. Never saw a "complimentary New York Times" Might be ok to use as base for holiday (location is excellent and there is good cupboard space for luggage/clothes) but avoid if visiting NY for business purposes and hope to do some work in your room in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the space!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandYelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham 1 Nov - 4 Nov 2008. Excellent suite room, loads of space, kitchenette area, lounge area with sofa bed so easy can accommodate 4 people. Great location 57st off 6 ave. Only 2 blocks away from Central Park, in the heart of everything...would book again.

Reviews.Title: “great location !”
Reviews.Author: virtaly
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the Buckingham ! We knew the location is very good but did'nt know how good it was. 20 seconds to the bussues or subway and you can travel all day long across new york, safe enviroment all day and night. Central Park is minutes away, and a supermarket is not far on the 57th. The hotel's info about culture in ny gave us the opportunity to see Gal Costa in a lovely Gazz bar. The room (14J) was rather small comparing to the pictures but very comfortable, not "fancy" but "home-like". there was planty of storage area. the kitchenet was hidden in a closet space - lovely idea... and we could actually cook real meals as the kitchen came with full set of cooking gear... the air condtioning system worked well, nice bathroom, clean room - we felt comfortable there. The view from the room was nice as you could see . becouse of the cooking possibility a nice saving can be achieved espicially for those who prefer home meals and hate fast food. we had families with kids as neigbors and i surely recommend this hotel to families - safe area, near the park, easy transportation, home cooking.... great. so - we had a great vacation and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: luckysnp1
Reviews.Content: For a family of 3 or 4 this is the place. Kitchen and separate LR. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Widely different rooms”
Reviews.Author: lilysdads
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Buckingham three separate times in the last few months, coming to NYC for business. While I have generally liked the property and especially its fantastic location, there is very little consistency in the quality of the rooms. From what I can gather this used to be (and I think some rooms still are) a resident hotel. I've had the deluxe one bedroom each time. One suite, had a mini kitchen, and one had a full kitchen. One had a new set of beautiful new furniture and new mattress and one had mismatched lamps and a creaky old bed. Can't quite figure it all out. I would return, but if I stay there for more than a day or so, I might not be settling for the first room they give me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: PurpleDivaWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time here! We didn't really know what was near the location, but it was such a delight to be so close to Central Park, especially when there was heavy overnight snow. The hotel staff were very helpful and gave us great information about eating nearby. The suites were very good, although the heating had to be coaxed into life, in mine, and the air condtioning system outside my room was incredibly noisy. However, I was so tired on the first night that I didn't notice it, and I managed to ignore it after that. The view from the room was all the air conditioning pipes and some very grim walls, but I didn't expect anything else in NYC and I was too eager to get outside to be looking out of the window! The subway is close by, which is very handy for going downtown. Altogether, a great place to be - will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Emanuela_Italy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! Location is perfect: 2 blocks from Central Park, a lot of buses and undergroud lines just outside the door; plenty of places to have dinner in a short walk (no more than 2 blocks). Starbucks just crossing the road. A big and excellent supermarket (WholeFoods) in Columbus Circle just 5 minutes walk away. We were 4: my husband, my 10 years-old son, my aunt and me. At the arrival we had a free upgrade to an executive suite (Room 3G). Huge apartment: very clean, very confortable, despite on a 3rd floor also the noise outside was acceptable (or may be we were too tired to pay attention to it...) My aunt slept on the sofabed (may be not too comfortable), while we shared the very comfortable king bed. Bath (little but clean and quite recent) was in the bedroom so that can be a little bit unconfortable if the suite is shared between couples. Kitchenette was small but very well appointed: enought for a good breakfast in the morning. May be the airconditioned was a bit noisy and in the lobby I was always freezing but the overall rating can only be excellent. I understand that not all the suites in this hotel have the same quality level and when I asked for a higher floor the concierge told me that on the 3rd floor the room was a lot better. So that explains why we find very different rating for this hotel. I believe that in NY if you sped 250$/night (in July) for that accomodation it is really a big deal!!! I would reccommend this hotel again and again. I would stay again there in my next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Stop the Whining! This place is a find!”
Reviews.Author: Hoach
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel knowing the location only. Raading the reviews I had some serious doubts but for the price and location it seemed worth the chance. Expecting the worst, I was pleasently surprised at the wonderful apartment like atmosphere and comfort of the room. The room was clean, spacious and had more than I expected. The "living room" was beautiful and a nice place to host visitors. With a small bar and modern kitchen it seemed like home. The bedroom was comfortable, clean and once more provided a private space away form the rest of the "apartment" The bathroom was a bit small but for NY standards quite sufficient. Two walk in closets, yes walk in closets, one in the foyer, and one in the bedroom provide more than enough space for my clothes, luggage, and the ironing board etc. Guest could actually hang there jackets up as they entered! Houskeeping was great and descrete, the front lobby awsome ,art deco, and the staff attentive. Based on the initial reviews and my experience, had I step into the twilight zone? If so book it next time! PS, the price for NY was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: SurferBetty
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on location and the price ($199/nite). The location was good - short walk from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. Lots of train lines nearby as well. I have to say, the hotel was quite the dump. Our room was dingy, the rug was ripped up, the TV was terrible (but who watches TV), the bathroom had hair all over the walls (gross), toilet was backed up when we checked in, the vents were filthy and the bed was terrible. I've been to New York many times and stayed at different hotels in different price ranges. I tried to stay out of the room as much as possible here because it skeeved me out. The vents were completely covered in dust, which made me wonder what the hell was I breathing. Don't be fooled, the lobby of the Hotel is beautiful and very modern, but the rooms are run down and not very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive at the price.”
Reviews.Author: james_t_dk
Reviews.Content: I stayed i 3G for a week. 3G is third floor on the corner of 57th street and 6th Avenue. This makes sure that you can hear the city, how ever after a full day of sightseeing even our 2 year old daughter had no problem sleeping. In my oppinion the noice of the city is part of the experience. 3G is a Deluxe 1 bedroom, and it is not like the one on the website. The furniture is a older and kept in brown, but in good condition. The rooms are big and there is lots of space arounf the bed. Enough room for a baby bed and a huge stroller. The living room has 2 sofas and a chair, a work table and a dining table. The small kitchen consistes only of a microwave oven. The bathroom is small, but when sitting on the "potty" you have the view over 6th avenue through the blinds. The hotel does not have a bar of lunchroom. How ever just up 57th street (less than 100 meters) there is the green cafe. Go here to get your breakfast. I can also recomend their sandwiches, they are a lot better than what I found elsewhere. on the oposite corner of 57th and 6th you'll find Rue57. Go here for drinks and.... Well their service and food is top of the line at a very nice price. The service in the hotel. I've stayed in a lot of hotels mainly in London, Zürich and Gibraltar. I have never felt so welcome or had such quick responce to any type of requests. Not even when I asked for change to the in house laundrett (50+ quarters). They will help you order takeout and they even have a book of menues from places they recomend. There is free wireless access on the second floor. In room internet access costs $12 a day. The second floor has a very nice lounge where you can do your netting.... I will be recomending this hotel to every one. But if you can't sleep for the noice of the city that never sleeps then ask for a room on a higher floor than 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “Great depending on what you pay”
Reviews.Author: PlanoJMF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about "value." I put value in quotes because it depends on what you paid. First, it's an old apartment building converted to a hotel. The studios are no bigger than a hotel room but the full one bedrooms are outstanding. Where else do you get like 700sf in NYC?! If you pay more than $350 a night I can see not being so happy with it. It's definitely not shiny and new inside. However, it definitely has character - and the good kind. Not the roaches and rats kind at all. I've stayed here twice based on hotwire (if it says there is a kitchenette in central mid-town manhattan you know something is up) and for the $225-$250 range it's outstanding. Location is amazing and it's clean. For that price, you truly can't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and dated”
Reviews.Author: TripperCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Hotel was noisy and furnishings were dated. Our first room reeked of cigarette smoke and when we turned on the lamp the shade fell off. The couch was so shabby I wouldn't have sat on it. I immediately requested another room and it was only slightly better. Hotel location was the best feature. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sjaybe
Reviews.Content: An unusual hotel in that there is no bar or restaurant, not even for breakfast or a coffee, but it's in a great location with a good choice of cafes, bars and restaurants very close by. In that way you spend less time in the hotel and more time getting a feel for the city, which is the whole point of going to NYC. Another plus point is the rooms are spacious and as far as I know all have a sort of kitchenette with a fridge and at least the basics, so you can stock up with drinks and a few snacks if you want to. My room also had a walk-in wardobe with plenty of space, so the bedroom didn't get cluttered up. Bathroom a little bit tired but clean, complimentary soap & shampoo and plenty of hot water, so no problem. Reception staff friendly and helpful, and there's a comfy sort of small lounge on the 2nd floor where you can chill out and read the paper or watch tv (but no drinks). Would I stay there again? Yes. One suggestion to the management, get some new flags to hang over the entrance, the ones there now are tattered and dirty, spoiling the look of the place. (May 08)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hadar321
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great, close to everything! 5-10 minutes walk from broadway, 3 minutes walk to the fifth avenue and 2 mintes walk to the central park, with a subway station right next to the hotel! the rooms where pretty and very clean, just like living in New York.. we went to a close supermarket and bought food, and in the morning we ate in our room, since we had a nice small kitchen in our room and a small dining place.. every room is decorated differently since it's a boutique hotel.. the view was great, and the staff were very nice! next to the hotel there is a nice deli and in a short walk you can enjoy an amazing italian restaurant with the best pizza in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Midtown stay”
Reviews.Author: JRM79
Reviews.Content: Our room in Hotel Buckingham was comfortable and spacious. The main living area and bedroom had been recently remodeled - the kitchen and bathroom areas were still a little dated but absolutely sufficient. The atmosphere of the whole hotel is very cool - lots of jazz motifs - very evocative of New York. I slept on a sofa bed in the living room - as sofa beds go it was passable. Not hugely comfortable, but I did sleep ok. The pillow was great. The noise from the street outside was a bit intrusive on a couple of nights as there was work going on in the street below. But it's Manhattan - I can't imagine there are many places that aren't noisy at night! The best thing about this place for me was the location. I spent a lot of time in theatres, and W57th was almost ideal walking distance to all of them. Subway station metres away. Two blocks from Central Park. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: cvfugitive
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. This is a smaller hotel that gives great service. The staff was always willing to help out, look up different locations, and print out directions for us at a moments notice. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were cozy. We always had hot water.

Reviews.Title: “great space for a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: molly2428
Reviews.Content: Room 7g,was just like having an a 1 bedroomed apartment which was clean with loads of space ,kitchen ,dining area,large living area and bedroom.Decor a bit dated but at $ 229 a night a bargain.Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent travel to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Iowa_Commuter
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler to NYC, last year spending parts of 21 weeks, and always stay at the Buckingham Hotel. It is always great to get back to a friendly place with very good service. I recommend the Buckingham to anyone I know who will be visiting NYC. Frequent NYC Traveler

Reviews.Title: “Love The Buckingham”
Reviews.Author: wilsonella
Reviews.Content: I haved stayed @ the buckinham for over 5 years. The location is ideal and the staff is more than gracious. The rooms are spacious and clean..most importantly. The rooms also provide kitchens which I find to be one of most attractice qualities of this hotel. I would definitley recommend staying @ The Buckingham. You will find it to be a pleasureable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Go by the photos on THIS site, not the hotel's website!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyPup
Reviews.Content: I am willing to bet good money that the room photos on the hotel's website were NOT taken at the hotel... I am 100% serious. I've stayed in a lot of NYC hotel rooms (at all price points), so I like to think I have some idea of what to expect when I arrive. Let's just say that the Buckingham kept me guessing! The exterior and lobby of the hotel are very nice... The hallways are clean and nicely decorated...Then, you open the door to your room and WOW. It's immediatelty like being in a cheap roadside motel. My bed was LITERALLY concave, with a deep sag that I could easily see from the doorway. The bathroom was the size of an airplane bathroom, and I had to walk in completely and close the door all the way in order to sit on the toilet. Luxurious! I had to rent a cable modem to have internet access in my room. Modern! There was ONE bellman for the whole hotel, and he was busy doing something else every single time I saw him (I stayed for three nights). Service! All in all, it was very much like staying at a friend's place - kinda crummy, but there's obviously no point in complaining. They're not going to, like, RENOVATE the hotel for you or anything... I liked that my room faced the street (even though yes, it was loud as hell), and that the window opened. My company was paying for the stay, otherwise... if it had been my own money, I would have changed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Buckingham”
Reviews.Author: kathbon36
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for it's location (57th and 6th) and reasonable price. We even called ahead about parking, and were told the bellman would direct us. Well, when we arrive there was no bellman in sight. We brought our bags in, and my husband asked the front desk for directions to their discounted parking garage. In that short 2 minutes of time he received a $115 parking ticket, since there is no place to stop to unload your bags! No warning from the hotel staff either. The room as just okay -- parquet floors in need of refinishing, very small bathroom, nice kitchenette. When we tried to take a shower, hwever, the cold water did not work (the faucet was broken -- how could they not know?). The piece de resistence? The parking garage they directed us to was NOT the one with the discount -- they gave us the wrong directions.....so overnight parking cost $59. Do yourself a favor and pay more money for your room up front.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Saggy bed.”
Reviews.Author: keleivis
Reviews.Content: The location of the Buckingham, a couple of blocks south of Central Park, is superb. And in New York City, where you're rarely in your room anyway, your main requirement is a clean room and a comfortable bed. Our room, though worn around the edges, was basically clean. The bed, however, was saggy and uncomfortable. In our minds, this is inexcusable. For goodness sakes, take the revenue from just one weekend and install a proper mattress. Failure to provide this basic level of travel comfort does not reflect well on the skills of current management.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money, but don't have high expectations.”
Reviews.Author: larchris
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through Hotwire for $175 a night. They compared it to a Doubletree, which is a stretch, because with a hotel like Doubletree you can expect a standardized level of quality, which we did not see here. The lobby and hallways of the hotel are very cool- kind of art deco. The rooms, however, are shabby to say the least. They had a large throw rug over the most disgusting carpet I think I have ever seen in a hotel. Also, although we had a non-smoking room, the people next to us must have been chain smoking and it came right into our room. The room was freezing, too. The bed was not comfy either. We did have great water pressure in the shower, though! The best part about this hotel is its location. It's in a beautiful, safe neighborhood close to so much. For the price and location, I can put up with the funkiness of the rooms, but I'm not sure if others would be so forgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachTraveler08
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this property and I will stay here again. It was the perfect location for my conference at the Javitis and close to wonderful restaurants. I love being able to read the paper and make my own breakfast in the morning. There is something about having a living room and kitchen that makes you feel like you are going home at the end of the day. The rooms are very clean but a little TLC is needed. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. You do get noise if you are on the lower floors facing the street (57th or 6th Ave).

Reviews.Title: “Needs new furniture and noise insulation.”
Reviews.Author: denglish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well below standard. The suite was spacious but the so called "pullout" bed wasn't fit for sleeping on [cheap and damaged] , and almost fell apart when opened. Nothing was done to rectify this despite our request. This is a shame as the location is excellent . The heating was very good but difficult to control with a hidden panel hard to find. The worst aspect [ apart from the sofa/bed] was the noise. The windows are old single glazed and ill fitting and have almost nil sound insulation quality. The sad thing is this hotel must cost a fortune to heat and is wasting energy. There is no excuse for poor furniture either.. The residents lounge is well appointed and we used that for free wireless internet access which is very handy. There is also a small gym which we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: harryAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay at the Buckingham. The room had a strong unpleasamt smell. was dirty and in poor condition. The heating worked intermittently but sometimes blew out cold air. The room looked nothing like the gleaming photos on the website. The bathroom had no ledge space, was moldy and the light had to be left on all night to deter the many cockroaches of varying size. Needless to say in view of the cockroaches we did not attempt to use the rather spartan kitchen. The one plus was the location but shop around. You must be able to find better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Had some issues”
Reviews.Author: CMarin03
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is excellent and the rooms are very clean. Our suite was a one bedroom apartment with a full kitchen but a very small bathroom. The staff is friendly and helpful but the rooms do need to be revised. The linens and bedding was hard and outdated. The air conditioner did not work and the heater was on and could not be turned off or adjusted. Althought it was cold outside we felt we were in a sauna and had to open the windows for air. We were told by the staff that at a certain temperature outside the air would not turn on and the heater would go on automatically. This was not a good thing......we were sweating even with the windows open....... I would however stay there again if they can guarantee this be corrected because of price, size and location.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying in a Friend's Apartment---Not Perfect, but Very Good”
Reviews.Author: kswl
Reviews.Content: We were a family group of 11 traveling to New York for four nights. There were two young children and two of our party had special dietary requirements, so we knew the suites with kitchenettes would suit our needs. I booked three rooms (for 5 / 3 / 3 ) that were all the same price ($379 plus tax per night). We were assigned 4G, 8K and 12K and gave out the keys at random. All three rooms were one-bedroom suites with kitchenettes; this is an apartment building that is being converted, apartment by apartment, into hotel rooms. All had been renovated to some degree, and two were typical one-bedroom city apartments with a smallish bath. One suite (4G) was much larger (about 800 sq.ft) and more luxurious (a relative term, certainly) with many windows on two sides, two large closets, larger bathroom, etc. Despite the differences in sizes, they were all the same cost (including tax, about $440 per night.) All the G rooms are the same size, FYI. The K rooms are smaller and laid out differently. The location was perfect for our itinerary. There was a nicely appointed, smallish lounge and business center on the second floor, and a wonderful laundry in the basement with six coin-op washers and dryers, $1.75 each. The dryers ran 60 minutes for that price. Also in the laundry room: two clean folding tables, drink and snack machines, and a small commercial icemaker. The housekeeping office was next door to the laundry. Although the hotel does not have a coffee shop or room service, the Green Cafe two doors up is everything one could want in a quick deli/diner. Two blocks over, the M&W had a complete selection of hot and cold prepared foods and not a bad beer/wine assortment for a grocery store. A Cafe Europa on the corner was a good place for a glass of wine or late meal. One of our rooms had a slow drain problem that was fixed within a few hours of being reported. None of the sofa beds was comfortable, and there was a waiting list for rollaway beds. The housekeeping was good, and the front desk staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel was very accessible to the theater district, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park. We had no trouble getting taxis at the corner of 57th and Sixth Avenue. I would like to address the subject of noise, as it seems such an issue with people writing unflattering reviews of this hotel. New York City is loud. If you are on the fourth floor---or even the 12th---you are going to hear city noise at night. It really doesn't have that much to do with the windows, either. People who have never been to NYC or have only stayed in a high-rise hotel are going to be surprised at how loud a lower floor can be. That does not reflect poorly on the Buckingham! It's even more odd, considering there is an all-night pharmacy across the street that sells very cheap ear plugs if one really couldn't sleep.... all I can gather is that people would rather complain about something that can't be changed than take steps to mitigate its effects. I would unreservedly recommend this hotel for people traveling with children, and because of the large sizes, for those who would rather have more space than more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Buckingham Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stillpeople
Reviews.Content: A spacious hotel in New York City! We had a great experience here ... great location and roomy suite. Our room had a living room and a kitchen - the space was unheard of in New York City. We got a bargain by booking on line but my understanding is they have new ownership and will be remodeling ... prices are sure to go up because this place was a steal in New York's world! We were able to walk to Central Park, the Russian Tea room and Columbia Circle. Nice access to subway too. This place touts its musical history but what makes it great is the location and the space! Hope you get to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: HonestMichael
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Buckingham with two colleagues. What can I say? The service was shocking, the room was the worst I have ever seen, the bathroom was disgusting and there was a strange smell. All for 420 dollars per night. Avoid it at all costs. If this is the only hotel available then delay your trip. How anyone can rate this higher than terrible is beyond me. I stay in a hotel at least 2 nights a week, in many different countries. This was worse than the night I spent in a rat infested hotel in Guyana.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: MJMoore
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to NYC and Mid town Manhattan was recommended as the place to stay. Booked this hotel for 7 nights as it was in a good location at a reasonable price. First impressions were good as the room we were given was large, bright and clean. Small things didn't work, like lamps and controlling the sound on the tv. The room, 9h, faced the street outside. We expected some street noise during the night, but didn't expect the noise to be so loud that you felt like you were sleeping on the sidewalk. We requested a different room and for the second night stayed at the back of the hotel (room 8d). The central air conditioning ouside the window was loud enough to ensure another sleepless night. The beds in both rooms had mattresses that were well past their sell by date. Between sagging in the middle and waking up with bite marks, by the following morning we'd had enough. We checked out and stayed the remainder of the week in the marriott marquis in times square which we couldn't recommend enough. Fantastic hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Rawgy
Reviews.Content: Rooms large but very tired and shabby. Decided to make the best of it , that was until I stepped out of the shower to find I was sharing the bathroom with a couple of cockroaches! Hotel reception sent someone upto the room to catch them armed with ...... two paper towels and a bad attitude? I asked to change rooms and was told the hotel was fully booked. Seriously contemplated a night in central park on a bench but dozed with one eye open and checked out the following morning. Stayed my remaining two nights in the Sheraton Towers which was a palace compared. Still chasing a refund via the booking company.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not worth the Bucks”
Reviews.Author: blackrose916
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty dark and dingy room. I understand some NYC hotels are older and I am taking this fact into consideration. What I didn't like was the fact that the sound on some of the TV stations didn't work and when we told the front desk, nothing was done about it...and we were there for five nights. We didn't make a big deal about it because we weren't in the room all that much. I also didn't like that the maid didn't change the sheets ONCE while we were there...how do I know this? Because there was a tiny hole in the sheet, and unless EVERY set of sheets had a hole in the exact same spot, she didn't bother to change them once. The bathroom sink drained very, very slowly. Again, I understand the pipes were old. The front desk people were okay except for one gentleman. He actually was quite rude to us on two separate occasions. Would I stay there again? I might as long as I got a newly renovated room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a miss”
Reviews.Author: harters
Reviews.Content: We booked the Buckingham because of three things - the space you get with suites, its location and reviews here some months back. It cost us $386 per night, which may not be overly expensive for the location but did not feel like good value. The good points are, indeed, the location being only 5 minutes walk south of Central Park and the amount of space you get. It has good kitchen space with cutlery, crockery, cooker and fridge/freezer. Staff were efficient and helpful However, the furnishings and decorations are shabby and in real need of updating. Our suite (6C), overlooked the central shaft, so there was no view but, in theory, this meant we wouldnt be disturbed by the noise from traffic. We weren't - but the noise of the air conditioning more than made up for it. It was necesssary to turn off the units at night otherwise sleep was impossible which, of course, meant the room became hot. And, even then, the noise in the ventilation shaft from "central" air con. was very loud. I would not return until I knew major refurbishment had taken place.

Reviews.Title: “Get Some Sleep, Just Not At The Suckingham Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnlovestennis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night and that was enough. Save your money and get some sleep. The Suckingham, as I now call it, is a converted apartment building. I've stayed in these kinds of places before, but this one was the worst. While the rooms are actually small apartments, I found mine to be completely horrendous -- moldy smelling, with complete with crappy, tacky furniture. The mattress was easily 10 years old and the frame was barely screwed into the headboard, so everytime I moved I squeaked like hell. These are fine features if you're trying not to get a good night's sleep. I was honestly afraid to put my feet directly on the 3" thick shag carpeting after flashing on what might be found in this room with a black light. Add to this that I cut my toe -- yes, cut my toe -- on the parquet flooring, where nails were sticking up about 1/4 inch near the heating unit. Basically I was hoping to get the mold smell out by circulating some air in there. Silly me. As for the bathroom: I wouldn't take a shower in that room if you paid me. They also don't have a restaurant, or a bar, which is okay. If you're in Manhattan, you should go out. It does kind of suck that they don't even offer coffee in the lobby in the morning though. Speaking of the lobby, the thing is a giant echo chamber. A family with a little boy was there when I was checking in, and I couldn't hear the desk clerk over their conversation. And when the kid started crying (which I don't blame him for, having stayed at The Suckingham now myself), forget it. We would have had a better time hearing each other if we walked out onto 6th Avenue. And of course they screwed up my bill, and our travel department had to resend everything again -- twice. Are you surprised? I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and hope that things are different if you have a family who is on a budget, but I am loathe to say my company paid $300 for this dump. Sadly, for that money, I could have done much better. The only reason I booked into this place is because one of my colleagues was there and we needed to meet. I now seriously regret it. And he's on my s-list.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers should avoid! Horribly managed.”
Reviews.Author: starblossom
Reviews.Content: Smoking rooms are on the same floor as non-smoking rooms. Given that the heating/air cond is quite old (and loud), smoke filters quickly from one room to the next. Staff not sympathetic to this and other issues. I had a health related emergency, and the front desk wanted me to call 911 directly. The next day when I was released from the hospital, the air conditioner broke. I asked the manager if he could tell me when it could be fixed, he had me waiting in the lobby for an hour. It wasn’t until I went up to him a 3rd time that he told me that the electrician had already been up to fix it. This was one of my worst experiences staying in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham 15-17 August based on the reviews for a family hotel here on TripAdvisor. It certainly didn't disappoint - we had a one bedroom suite which was more like a large apartment - huge lounge with a pull out bed - well resourced kitchen - large master bedroom and good sized bathroom (I agree with the previous posting about the shower - it was brilliant). Staff were lovely. If I was looking to complain - the main bed or pullout bed were not particulary comfortable, and the air conditioning unit in the bedroom was noisy - but both of these I'm sure would have been sorted out if we were staying out for longer - I didn't even bother notifying the hotel of this. Not having a resaurant in the hotel was not a problem as there is the Green Cafe about 1 minute away which has an extensive eat-in or take-away menu. Duane Reade is opposite for milk, water and basic supplies for the kitchen. The hotel itself is in a brilliant location - we were near central park and shopping . I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a family and we will definately be staying here again next time we cross the pond.

Reviews.Title: “Obne of the worst experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Sleepuneezy
Reviews.Content: The family of four turned up and were greeted well enough. In particular the guy handling the bags was really good and helpful. The room was not ready so we waited in a nearby deli for a while. The general decor was 'tired' throughout. the non stop muzac/jazz irritated almost as much as the intrusive honking of horns from the nearby intersection, heard reasonably clearly despite being on an upper floor thanks to the ill fitting windows. We had booked a 'suite' which included a kitchen - reasonably equipped, one double bed and one sofa bed. the living room and bedroom were OK and sized well for four. The en-suite toilet/bath/shower was cramped and definately in need of modernising. The joke of the whole stay was the sofa bed. When extended the foot of the bed sloped off to such an extent you have needed surgery to make contact with it whilst lying on the main part . The main section combined the thinest, most uncomfortable 'matress' i have ever felt along with undulations and contours that ensured anyone using it was forced to the centre of the bed. the combination of faults rendered sleep all but impossible, and made the hard floor seem most attractive. Exiting the hotel the next morning we suggested that the sofa bed was entirely inadequate and could something be done about it. Re-assured we went for a day out in New York. On returning at about 10 p.m we discovered that nothing had changed. A visit to the front desk revealed two desk clerks, neither of who could do anything as they were 'only front desk people' , the hotel was full and maintenance had gone home. When I suggested they raise the issue with someone who could do something I was informed the manager would be asleep - not really the right thing to say to someone about to endure a second sleep free night. The headclerk did agree that the sofa beds were entirely rubbish though, which was reassuring that it was not just me being picky. After informing them that I intended sleeping in the lobby as it would be more comfortable, providing I was unable to find an alternate hotel I went back to my room and started leafing through the yellow pages. About two minutes later a knock at the door and a (single) roller bed was pushed into the room. One of us still had to sleep on the (folded up) sofa and the situation was not improved through the remaining 3 days of our stay. I may have been rendered suddenly deaf but I did not hear any expression of regret or apology from any of the staff. On leaving the chap handling our bags was as good and helpful as on the way in. On the penultimate night I ran into a fellow guest in the lift who casually asked if I would stay again. My response was 'No', hers was the same as she too had a 4 person booking in one room - same sofa bed probllem, added to by black mould and even poorer bathroom facilities. After this review anyone who tries to stay 4 in a room at this place has only themselves to blame. I have rated this as terrible as the primary responsibility of a hotel is to provide adequate sleeping accomodation, in this respect they failed.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in New York City”
Reviews.Author: janran
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to request a room on a high floor instead we were put on the 6th floor on the corner of 57th St & 6th Ave. All night long, every 10 minutes someone honked or a siren went by. This hotel is on a very busy corner of Manhattan and if you are not put on a top floor you can forget about a good night's sleep. While the rooms are relatively spacious, the sofa bed is so uncomfortable that you might as well sleep on the floor. The rooms are clean but they are tired very and in desperate need of some TLC. The furniture was frayed! We ended up leaving a night early bc/we couldn't take the noise anymore or the rudeness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Buckingham "Palace"”
Reviews.Author: Tsissy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to New York City, staying at the Buckingham Hotel. The hotel was better than I had expected especially for the money. The air conditioner in the room was awesome, especially welcoming after being out in the heat and humidity during the day. THe location at 57th and 7th street is perfect to get anywhere. The subway is on both 6th and 7th streets. It is a short walk to Central Park, FAO Schwartz, 5th Avenue Shopping, Rockefeller Center and Times Square just to name a few. The "studio" room was very spacious for New York standard hotels. The "mini kitchen" was great too! Refrig, microwave, coffee maker, sink. Hotel was very clean and staff helpful when needed. The deli a few doors down has great food, sandwiches, breakfast items, drinks, etc. I would definitely stay at the Buckingham again and again. Great value and great location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: londonwpr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Buckingham on business and it was a wonderful experience. It you're in NY for a few days, I highly recommend staying here. My room was huge. I had a full kitchen, dining area, living room, large bedroom and bathroom. The location is great...very close to Central Park. My only complaint is that it didn't have an onsite restaurant, but with all of the perks of this hotel I can easily overlook that!

Reviews.Title: “Buckingham was great!”
Reviews.Author: Woodenclogs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in NYC at the Buckinham. We were 3 women who were "reuniting" and a 19 year old guy (my son). It was everything I had hoped for from the hotel website and the positive reviews on this site. Our suite was like a small apartment--very large, and comfortable. Lots of nice little touches, too, like the CD player, the mirrored closets in the hall, etc. We found the front desk people to be very helpful-- Location was perfect--a 10 minute walk to the theater; one block to Central Park--a drug store, Starbucks, deli's on the street, and a little food store around the corner, where we picked up breakfast stuff, drinks, etc. One of our party is pretty phobic and picky--she told me afterward that she had fully thought she would be finding her own place after the first night (no way 4 of us could stay in one place) but she was pleased! Tip: the health club on second floor has a shower, so guests could pop down for a shower there if the one bathroom was a problem. Also, the basement has a laundry room (6 washers/dryers) which is not in the information in the room, for some reason. Also a snack and soda machine, and ice machine, which is not listed either. Would recommend it to everyone and definitely plan to revisit the Buckinham myself!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWayGirl
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. Central Park is write around the corner.,take a 20 minute carriage ride for $40. You can walk to the theater district or pay $5 for a 8 minute cab ride. The hotel is down the street from the (R, N & Q) line which we took straight to Battery Park to catch the ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. If you choose to drive in to N.Y., you will have to self park at a garage which will run you about $35/day for a car and $50/day for a SVU. The hotel room of course didn't match the ones pictured on the hotel website but the room was surprisingly spacious and very clean with little necessities like a working kitchen, CD/Radio, DVD/VCR player and two T.Vs. The staff was very nice. I must warn you not to sleep on the sofa bed. I believe it contains more springs than mattress. All in all I would stay at this hotel again, mainly for its location and its price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: dw_seattle
Reviews.Content: Heard about a special sale in June on TravelZoo for $219 a night for a Deluxe 1 BR. Booked directly through Hotel's site. The rooms, beds, and sofa-beds are a little tired and out-of-date but clean. Service provided daily. The location is what can't be beat if you have kids. We stayed in 16F. Weekend rate is slightly higher - $239-$259. Internet is pretty high - $12.00 a day for a device. However, business lounge on 2nd floor provides free wireless (albeit slow) You are almost across the street from Carnegie Hall Grocery store - is just 1 block west past 7th. A Whole Foods is in the basement of TimeWarner building in Columbia Circle. Great place to stock up and get your pre-cooked meals. Great mac-n-cheese for kids. Duane Reed - there is one across the street, 2 on 7th Starbucks - across the street Dry Cleaning/Laundry Service (charged by the pound) - there are 2 behind the hotel on 58th. Much cheaper than hotel's service. Deli - The Green Cafe - get your cheese slice and soda for under $5.00 Subway - there is a stop on 6th and 57th that takes you mid-town. 2 blocks takes you to Columbia Circle to catch the 1,2,3 to downtown. Moms/Dads - Central Park - Hecksher playground is just 3 blocks away (walking distance). An absolutely wonderful play area for toddlers and kids. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Location, Clean, Friendly, Spacious”
Reviews.Author: nissynis
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the Buckingham as part of a surprise anniversary weekend in NYC. The location is perfect as we could walk up through Central Park and later down to the Theater District. The suite was spacious, with a full fridge and kitchen, though we spent so little time in the room! Best shower I've had in a year - water pressure like I was standing under a waterfall. The staff is friendly, the place is clean and well decorated, and it is within sight of a subway stop. I booked it as a package with my flight, and the hotel was about $220 for one night. I will stay at the Buckingham for any future trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great value”
Reviews.Author: LKMiami
Reviews.Content: It's rare to find a good hotel deal in NYC, but the Buckingham is just that. It was very comfortable and hospitable just stylish enough to be fun without being "over the top."

Reviews.Title: “the Gem in the City is Just as good”
Reviews.Author: onetravels
Reviews.Content: Well I did say I would be back at the Buckingham Hotel. I had stayed here before and had a great time, and now was able to get a great deal on Orbitz for a one bedroom suite. The room was just as spacious as I remembered and this time I had company, my wife and son joined me. The staff was great and helpful, they joked around with my son and made him feel special everytime we came through the lobby, he loved playing with the lights in the floor. Candise and Gerald at the desk were great help, and King the bellman helped us get a taxi out for dinner. The Room was very clean and had enough space the family did not feel crampped at all. I did have to call down on the first night for extra bedding for the sofa sleeper, but the staff was quick in bringing it up to us. I know i said it before, but I will say it again, I will be back. Thank you Buckingham Hotel for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: fix2a3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Buckingham Hotel for 5 nights in mid-April 2007. We booked via the hotels website, and got a rate of $219 (plus taxes) for the standard room. it was well-equipped (video player, CD, kitchnettett, safe). We stayed on the 15th floor, and our room facing 57th Street was a bit noisy, with the 4 AM garbage truck, 24/7 police sirens and what have you, so if you are sensitive, you might want to chose a room facing the back. Otherwise the hotel was flawless: the desk downstairs, amenities, cleaning, the bed, everything just perfect (and we are pretty fuzzy). Free wireless in the comfortable business center (but a charge of $12 if you want it in your room). Faboulus value for the location and standard. Highly recommended. And a nice breakfast deli just next doors.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Tilly99
Reviews.Content: When our family of four, including two young children, decided to spend a week in New York, we landed at the Buckingham Hotel for five days in April 2007. We booked the reservation through the hotel's website, convinced that we had found a great deal: a spacious suite in a convenient location for less than we'd historically paid in better-known places that, when occupied with people and suitcases, seemed to offer only cramped rooms-turned-obstacle-courses. We were not disappointed. I admit, however, I was initially taken aback when, a few days before arriving, I confirmed our reservation over the phone. The person I spoke with was quite rude, insisting that my confirmation number-- the only one I'd been given, and I had the email to prove it-- was incorrect. I'm pleased to report, though, that during our actual stay every employee we encountered was pleasant and helpful. On first impression, our suite looked a bit dated and dingy. But with each passing day, it felt more comfortable. This was due in no small part to an excellent housekeeping staff. Each morning, they cleaned and vacuumed thoroughly, and left ample supplies, including linens, shampoo/conditioner, soap, and dishwashing liquid and paper towels for the kitchenette. The hotel seemed to be occupied by a healthy mix of business travelers, families, and people we assumed to be professional musicians. We were pleasantly surprised by the unexpected amenities-- including free wireless Internet access in the lobby and in the nicely appointed second floor lounge, and a more-than-adequate fitness center and sauna. And of course the excellent location, close to Central Park, Times Square/theatres, and Fifth Avenue shopping-- didn't disappoint. Drawbacks: the pull-out sofa mattress was uncomfortable at best, our kitchen cabinets contained only a few plates/bowls, cups, etc., and the parquet floors were joltingly slippery. But the positives-- the generous space, the numerous closets, the divided rooms, the kitchen appliances, the world-class "elevator music" and the in-room CD player (and 2 TVs)-- far outweighed the negatives. I wholeheartedly recommend the Buckingham, especially for value-minded families who can appreciate the extra elbow room. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the buck”
Reviews.Author: maemae617
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 2 daughters during spring break from 3/28-3/30 of 2007. I was pleasantly suprised with this room, i have seen and stayed in other hotels in new york and for this price (i paid $200 per night through a promotion from travel zoo ) this hotel was a good deal. I agree with some of the other reviews that it is dated but the hotel is close to subways and central park and a nice little walk to the theatre district. the only thing they should deep clean the area rugs in the rooms, they were a little dingy looking but beside that , the rooms were very clean. Overall a great hotel i would highly recommend it. in fact we decided whenever we come to new york, we will definately be staying at the Buckingham.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weeklong stay”
Reviews.Author: sea-a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a one bedroom deluxe suite. I had requested a high up floor with optimal views. As an artist, I sketch what I see from hotel windows. The first room we were sent to was 7E; we were told it was the highest room available. It looked out on 6th Ave. and a wall of the adjoining building :(. 7E was dingy, cold, and not anywhere as nice as the hotel's website pictures. WIthout delay--I knew I would not be happy in 7E for 8 nights, I called the front desk to see if there were any alternatives. A man, rather than the woman who had initially checked us in, answered. Hearing my request for a nicer room, without pause, he told me 16G was available. 16G was spectacular! It was right on the corner of 6th and W57th with fabulous cityscape, long views out all our many windows :). It was much larger than 7E (which we would have been charged the same price), looked as nice as the website photos, and served our needs perfectly. Since we eat only one meal out (usually midday) when staying for a week, we stocked up the ample, apartment size kitchen with breakfast foods and evening snacks. We even used the oven to heat up our Andre's Bakery cabbage strudel. No problem with the heat and it was one of Janauary's colder weeks. The livingroom/diningroom was great to come back to unwind and make plans for the next day's excursion. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was more than adequate (great water pressure and always with hot). Great closet space. The housekeeping was superlitive. Too bad there isn't wireless ethernet in the rooms. I chose not to pay for the extra hookup in the room, but went down to the lounge on the second floor where there is free wireless ethernet connection. The location can't be beat: walking, taking the subway or immediatley catching a cab. The Buckingham has set a high standard for what I will now want for a NYC stay. At $239/night for 16G, I found it to be excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Valentines Gift Ever”
Reviews.Author: LouZ
Reviews.Content: This past Sunday I stayed at the Buckingham Hotel as part of a Valentines Day Gift for my girlfriend. This hotel is great, the staff is helpful, the location is great, we walked to Moma and some shopping on 5th Ave. We could have walked 2 blocks to central park but it was freezing out. We stayed in their Martinelli Penthouse, which in my opinion is one of the best in NYC. I have also seen their regular suites, which are more like having a cool NYC apartment for a week. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location location locaiton”
Reviews.Author: Sjmg2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great based on the location. You can't beat being 2 blocks from Central Park, and walking distance to the subway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall, etc. The staff at the hotel were pleasant, however our room was on the 4th floor and very noisy being right above a bus stop. One night the sheet on the bed had a rip in it, but other than that, the room was very clean. I agree with previous customers in that the bathroom is dated, however, the shower pressure was great, so no complaints there! The area the hotel is in is great, so if you're looking for a place to crash after a long day of sightseeing, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, if you don't expect a lot”
Reviews.Author: JadedInBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in December. Bottom line: the accomodations here are dated, but clean and comfortable. The hotel has nexxt to no amenities, but the location is excellent. The rooms are decorated in various shades of brown, if you like that kind of thing. Old bathroom fittings (shower controls could probably fetch a good sum in antique market!) but everything was clean. TV but no cable, CD player and VCR. Internet sevice comes from a device you rent from them that sends data through the electrical outlet - worked perfectly well. No restaurant, no room service, but there are great restaaurants on 7th Avenue and beyond. The hotel has a tradition of hosting musicians, with Carnegie Hotel being almost opposite, but they piped opera music into the hallways all night! I never much liked opera, now I really can't stand it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: clsmit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham over Labor Day weekend 2006. There were 4 in our party: my husband, me, and our kids ages 7 and 10. The rooms are actually good-sized apartments. Ours was one of the larger ones on a corner. It has a huge room with a king sized bed and a living room with a queen pull out bed. The kids loved having their own space. There was a ton of closet space. The bathroom was a bit small and dated, but that was not a problem -- everything worked fine. The full kitchen had all the equipment needed for cooking meals. It is at a subway stop and just down the block from Carnegie Hall -- very convenient to Times Square, museums, shopping, Central Park, etc. If you want more space than a normal New York hotel room for roughly the same price, give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Travelkidd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckingham May 19-22, 2006. We came across the hotel when looking for suites on the net. The location is great (midtown-west), half block from Central Park. The hotel room had a seperate bedroom and a pull out couch. The room was very clean, nicely furnished and included cable, CD player, AC and kitchen. Only a $10 cab ride lower Manhattan and a subway station around the corner. There are also some great restaurants within steps as well as a convenience/drug store across the street. The staff was friendly and approachable. All in all - amazing price for a suite given the location and city. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1-bedroom deluxe suite June 12 - 17th and had a terrific experience. The room was huge for NYC, and we have stayed in quite a few midtown hotels over the years. Very clean, no complaints whatsoever. The location is excellent, not right on a subway line but we generally walked everywhere anyways if not we could always get a cab right in front of the hotel. We would stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at Buckingham!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Buckingham from April 3-7 (4nts), and stayed in the Executive King Suite (w/850 sqft...which is superb for a New York hotel, or any other city for that matter). We got a seasonal rate for $279/nt and it was well worth it. We got a suite on the 8th floor which faced the Duane Reade on 57th St, and it was bright and spacious throughout. We had a nice little kitchenette w/silverware; a dining area w/table and chairs, and a large living room with an entertainment center including cd & dvd player next to a writing desk. The private bedroom couldn't have been better -- it had two closets, one of which housed the in-room safe, a large king-sized bed with extra sheet inside one of the closets. I was skeptical at first because of the other reviews I'd read before check in at the hotel and even brought my own sheets, but after arriving at the hotel all my fears were put to rest, the hotel was wonderful. Few cons: If you're not used to street noise, come prepared -- it's New York City -- you're going to hear honking of car horns, emergency vehicle sirens, you name it... I used to live in NY and already knew what I was in store for. The bathroom was small but had enough space to manuever. We really only had trouble with one thing -- the heat. We visited on an unusually cold week in April (it snowed on the Wednesday), and the heater blew out cold air a few times. The hotel staff was courteous and professional; knowledgeable of the area. The location was great -- it's across the street from Carnegie Hall, about two blocks from Central Park, and within walking distance of Radio City Music Hall, Times Square and all the sparkly bright lights of the area. Not to mention the easy access to the subway. All in all, we couldn't have asked for a better hotel, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Primo Location and Lots of Space!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuperTrooper_SoCal
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed at the Buckingham Hotel from April 27-May 1, 2006. I decided to be guarded yet optimistic based on the reviews I had read about this hotel. I have to say that I was very pleasantly surprised with the hotel and staff. The front desk staff was nothing but helpful from the moment we arrived until check-out. I had anticipated needing to schlep my own bags to the room and do without any concierge services. I was wrong. The staff was more than willing to answer all our questions about transportation and directions regarding the subway system. They even arranged for a private car to take us to the airport. Now I do agree with other reviewers in that our room, a one bedroom deluxe suite, did not resemble the room shown on the website. However, the room was clean, comfortable and very large for a room of comparable price in NYC. The kitchen was fully equipped with a stove, microwave, refrigerator and utensils. The coffee maker left a lot to be desired though. It’s a little four cup model and was woefully slow and made very weak coffee. The coffee is free of charge and restocked every day so what can you say. Thankfully, there’s a Starbucks on every block surrounding the hotel. There were major street repairs going on throughout the city and unfortunately, right out in front of the hotel. Seeing as the repairs are made at night, it was very difficult to get a good night’s sleep during our stay. Even when the construction noise ceased, the street traffic was hard to get used to. Who needs sleep while on vacation right?! The primary reason that I will return to this hotel in the future is the location. It’s perfectly situated to many of the attractions in midtown Manhattan. We were able to walk to Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, Times Square, and the many luxury shops on W. 57th. A wide variety of subway lines are available just across the street from the hotel as well. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Buckingham and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Buckingham Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 101 W 57th St at 6th Ave, New York City, NY 10019
